title: Great Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: One of ten top best hotels in a FLORENCE
review: Adler Cavalieri is an excellent hotel in an excellent location, walking distance to most landmarks and many restaurants  Great service, friendly staff and an excellent breakfast. Will definitely stay here next time in Florence.

title: Excellent location
review: Dear janellocpa, Thanks so much for sharing a review with us, and how lovely to hear that you had a good time you stayed with us. I do hope that we will be able to welcome you back again very soon! Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Wonderful location in Florence
review: One of Ten top Hotel in Florence.  People is extremely nice and efficient.  Situated very close to the center in a very calm street. Price and quality very balanced and the bar is super nice and offering the right drinks.

title: Location, Location, Location
review: Dear italiano483, Thank you for your review from all the staff of Hotel Adler Cavalieri.. It was our pleasure to have you as our guest  and I hope to welcome you back again. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Very good

title: The finest in Florence
review: I and my family of four had a great stay from 2nd to 4th Sept. Its close to the Firenze train station and we walked easily crossing a couple of streets. We had a wuicj check-in with our online reservation. The place looked rather small, our 3rd floor rooms also seemed. However the rooms were comfortable and the hotel has a certain character built in to it being located in an older construction. The interior woodwork is very well done. The breakfast was good too with sufficient variety and great coffee, we loved the courtyard setting. The management was very helpful too. The day we were due for visit to Pisa, it started raining heavily. They were kind to provide us two umbrellas, which we somehow lost at Pisa while taking pics. While checking out I offered to pay for these but…

title: Nice hotel
review: What a find this was, central Florence with parking! Just a few meters away from the enigmatic historical old town and of course , the statue of David. The rooms are grand and spacious, immaculate and comfortable. We had petit dejeuner, really nice and a mixture of continental and warm food - scrambled eggs , bacon and sausage . The breakfast waiters were lovely and helpful. Reception was fast and efficient. We had a camper van, this was accommodated at an additional cost in a secure car park 5 mins away, all very smoothly operated . We have no hesitation in recommending this lovely hotel, it’s full of character and charm

title: Lovely experience in this beautiful city!
review: Dear 1963-bongo, Thank you for the beautifl review. I'm thrilled that our location worked so well for you and you had the chance to sample our delicious breakfast. Thank you so much for the special mention of all the staff, I will certainly share this with them. I hope to welcome you back soon. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: A great hotel in a beautiful city
review: Nice hotel with friendly staff in a great location. My only complaint was my wife and I had a room that overlooked the busy street (Via della Scala). We stayed on a Saturday night. The noise made it hard to sleep. I would stay in the hotelagain but not in that room.

title: A lovely hotel in a beautiful city
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Good location, very comfortable. Helpful staff.
review: We really enjoyed our stay at the Alder Cavalieri hotel. The hotel itself was very traditionally decorated which is in keeping with the vibe of Florence itself. The room was very spacious with plenty of storage to put everything, the shower was lovely and the air conditioning was good which is really important if you go in the summer months (temperatures were reaching the mid 30s whilst we were there!) The staff were really helpful and friendly. Breakfast was really good with a lot of choice. The location of the hotel was excellent. It was just a 10 minute walk to the Duomo and a 5 minute walk from the central train station. You could even pop back to the hotel to freshen up in between visiting the many sights that Florence has to offer which is very handy when the weather is…

title: Great Hospitality
review: Dear  louisepN5203GI, Thank you for taking the time to share your great review following your recent stay at Hotel Adler Cavalieri.I am so pleased to read that you had such a wonderful time at our Hotel. I have shared your feedback with my team . It made us all very proud! t! Thank you for staying during this trip to Florence. Warm Regards  Riccardo Ceseri

title: Great hotel for a large city
review: Very close to train station. 15 minutes walk to centre. Lovely room with large, private balcony and very clean and big bathroom. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definately recommend this hotel.

title: Another great stay
review: Nice and very clean.  Helpful front desk, and were able to store our luggage for us after checking out, as we had more of the city to see.  Was close to stores and restaurants, and not too far from the city center and plazas.  Maybe a ten minute walk.   Sometimes the rooms in Europe can tend to be small and this was similar, but par for the course.Breakfast was included and great also.  Shower was nice size .  Would stay there again.

title: Cozy hotel near train station
review: I do recommend this hotel for florence visitors , location is great as well as its decoration and great service of stuff very helpfull . The breakfast has big variety and the location is wonderfull !!

title: Nice Hotel near train and walking distance to many museums
review: Dear Celineadvice, Thank you for sharing your review of our Hotel. It was a pleasure to read your your kind words on our welcoming and attentive staff and I do hope to welcome you back to Adler Cavalieri very soon again. Best regards, Riccardo Ceseri

title: good stay
review: The Adler is an older building in the train station district, but we felt safe and enjoyed the location from which we walked everywhere.  The staff was efficient and helpful, the room and breakfast sufficient.

title: Just perfect location
review: We stayed at Adler Cavalieri for 6 nights in April.  The hotel is clean and the staff very friendly and helpful.  The weather was rainy and we were able to borrow an umbrella from the hotel.  The hotel has a rooftop area where you can get snacks (peanuts/chips/wine) but we didn't partake as we were so busy with our trip.  The breakfast was ample and delicious.  Most museums are 15 to 20 minute walk from the hotel.  Having the train a couple blocks away was helpful as this was our last leg of our trip and we had to take the train back to the Rome airport.  The only issue was we had a standard room and it was very small.  I would pick the next size room if we booked this hotel again.

title: Classy and classic hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Wonderful Hotel with The Best Staff
review: My husband and I stayed one night in the Hotel Adler Cavalieri.  I had stayed here with my son years ago and found it to be a good experience so we went back.  We only needed one night accommodation as we were staying at a friend's house for the following nights.  It is a classy and classic hotel close to the train station, but also within walking distance of whatever else you might want to see in Florence.  The staff were excellent and were knowledgeable on the questions we had.  The bathroom was quite large by European standards and had all the amenities, including an excellent shower.  The breakfast was amazing with hot and cold buffet!  I would stay here again and would recommend it.

title: Bye 2018
review: Dear Mary A, Thank you for your feedback and for taking the time to review your recent stay at our Hotel We are delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and will make sure to share your comments with our team for their  work.  We do hope to welcome you again at the hotel soon. Regards, Riccardo Ceseri

title: Excellent Breakfast
review: We were traveling with several family members and needed an affordable option in Florence. We were thrilled with our choice of this hotel! The rooms and common areas are clean and neat. The location is great and the beds comfortable. The breakfast had a variety of fresh and tasty options. To top it all off, the staff is very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend!

title: Comfortable hotel very close to train station
review: We had the pleasure of staying here during our 3 days in Florence. I was pleasantly surprised how extremely close it is to the train station. Our favorite restaurant 13 Gobbi was a hop, skip, and a jump away. Breakfast is satisfying with an accoutrements of items to choose from. We had 2 rooms. One with shower only and one with a tub and balcony. They both are lovely! Thank you for such a lovely time!!!

title: Great stay close to everything
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Good chance
review: We stayed for 4 nights, the room was very clean and comfortable, the bedding was very soft. Bathroom had a great shower, free toiletries. There was a kettle with tea and coffee provided.Free breakfast was lovely with some nice cold cuts, sweet pastries, yoghurts, fruit, I loved the marinated artichoke. Staff were friendly and looked happy.

title: Fine hotel with amazing staff, around the corner from the station.
review: Dear JanaZC, It is certainly a great reward to read such praising feedback from our valued guests, and we hope for the opportunity to host you again in the near future to create more beautiful moments. Best reagrds. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Even as a telephone booth....
review: The Adler Cavalieri is a good chance when in Florence, for a family or business stay. The hotel is very close to Santa Maria Novella Railway Station, and is placed at a walking distance of the main attractions in the city. Rooms are spacious and furnished in an elegant English style with an Italian touch, and the team is attentive to customers. The only point point in disfavor is the breakfast buffet, although being acceptable, could be a bit more varied. Definitely, I would come back.

title: Great location
review: Lovely, quiet room, well appointed, warm, professional staff - thank you Roberto, Simone and Davide!  GREAT breakfast, w/ gluten-free and dairy-free options. The hotel proper is in the high-european style - you expect James Bond to walk up next to you at the desk -

title: Great location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Small boutique hotel in easy walking distance of many sights
review: The hotel in Florence is conveniently located about 100 yards from the train station in the city center. Hotel staff are very friendly, helpful and speak English. The hotel is very clean with night hot showers. Great breakfast with lots of variety. The only down side is thin walls and small showers. Overall a very nice comfortable hotel.

title: Very comfortable and quiet in convenient central location
review: Visited here for four days while exploring Rome.  On the "opposite" side of the river from most sights it is still within easy walking distance on most everything- close to the Vatican and an easy stroll to the Spanish Steps for evening people watching and a coffee.  Rooms are small but well appointed with en suite baths, a nice breakfast spread included in the room rate, lovely garden for reading or writing and enjoying a small bite to eat.  Small local restaurants are within a short distance walk as well as some of the best gelato in Rome.  Two "supermarkets" also close by and with refrigerator in room we bought fresh fruit, cheese, and toast crips for snacking and bottled water for our daily strolls and sight-seeing.  Staff is friendly and accommodating - providing city maps…

title: Great Location Stunning Hotel
review: Hotel was chosen for proximity to SMN station, and was ideal.   Very noisy district, but once inside the doors, all was calm and peaceful.    Room was very comfortable (we had chosen a superior with balcony), and contained everything required except for decent coffee.   Good beds and excellent sleep.   Nice and clean. However, it was very difficult to get into the bath/shower, as the door was swinging back and forward.  Breakfast included was OK up to a point, although again the coffee was disappointing for Italy.   Hot breakfast on buffet was luke warm only, and some days scrambled eggs were actually cold.   Fruit on offer was not very good either.

title: Great location, very elegant and classy
review: A comfortable room and great location PLUS really nice breakfast. Make sure to include breakfast in your booking. 10 to 15 minute walk to Duomo, Ufizzi Museum, Mercato Centrale, and leather market.  Definitely recommend this place.

title: Great hotel with excellent staff and location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Fantastic hotel
review: The staff here are great.  They upgraded my room at no extra cost as I am here to celebrate my 50th birthday.  The hotel location is perfect as it is near the train station and you can walk to everywhere.    The WiFi works perfectly well.  They go the extra mile e.g the bedroom slippers are so fluffy and they had nice amenities in the bathroom .    They remodeled the front of the hotel so it doesn’t look as dreary as most of the hotels because the buildings are all old. I definitely will stay here again.  Thank you to all the staff.

title: nice hotel; great location
review: Dear Msnomi, Thank you so much for your lovely review as well as for your recent visit. We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay and especially your feedback regarding our team members whose passion for service you recognised. I do hope that we will be able to welcome you back again very soon! Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Very nice hotel with great location.
review: What can I say about this wonderful hotel. My wife is disabled and we had traveled across France and Italy and stayed in about 6 so called disabled friendly hotels . The Adler was the only one that was in fact very disabled friendly . The general manager was the nicest manager I have met in years ( apologies I should of wrote your name down) he was bald so you know who you are . The welcome was wonderful the assistance offers was so friendly they could not do more for us. It was the first time in a long time my wife had a nice normalish experience. Kudos to your hotel and your team . We will not Stay anywhere else when in Florence . The hotel is also so close to the city and everything is Beijing in walking distance.

title: Nice hotel, helpful staff, better than expected.
review: Dear Anto1705, Thank you so much from all the staff for taking the time to write a review and  I am so glad you enjoyed it, and we hope to have you back someday soon!. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Handy to all attractions
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Wonderfull ambiance and great staff
review: We stayed in this hotel as it was a part of a package for a sporting event that I was participating in. We caught the train into Florence and it was very close, within walking distance (even with bags). Our room has 2 bedrooms with a small kitchenette, which was very comfortable. Breakfast was included every morning, although it was not cooked to order. It still had all the essentials for you to eat well. The hotel was within walking distance of the main part of the city and good local restaurants. The reception staff were also very helpful.

title: Boutique Hotel Near Station
review: Came to the Adler Cavalieri hotel as a great startingpoint for my Firenze exploration. From the AirPort it was a 24,- fixed price taxi ride to the city center, where this hotel is aswell. A friendly front-office employee welcomed us in the hotel and helped us with a citymap, areas to see and visit aswell al recomending some restaurants in the area. A great start. The bellboy helped us with out luggage which was great.   The room, breakfast and bar are all just as discribed on the website. Just as good. Powerfull airconditioning was great!  Would recommend this hotel as a great starting point of your trip.

title: Very nice hotel
review: Dear Maurver, Thanks so much for sharing a review with us, and how lovely to hear that you had a good time you stayed with us and  your kind words on our welcoming and attentive staff. I do hope that we will be able to welcome you back again very soon! Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Central location with classic interior that sets the mood for this great city
review: Well maintained boutique hotel walking distance from the train station. Also within walking distance from the Florence attractions. Very helpful front desk staff and immediate help with our bags. Rooms are very nice and clean, nice bathrooms.

title: Comfortable for a week in Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Comfortable stay at an excellent location
review: We were a group of three so had a double room and a single room. Both rooms were very comfortable and we even had the added bonus of a terrace on the double room as it was on the first floor. The shower was a bit tight which is to be expected in an old building but everything else was fine. My only observation would be to ask for a bit more storage to allow for clothes as we found we were running out of room.

title: Beautiful room, great location
review: Dear Seb B, Thanks so much for sharing a review with us, and how lovely to hear that you had a good time you stayed with us and we assure you that we will take into account your suggestions. I do hope that we will be able to welcome you back again very soon! Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Great location, helpful staff, good rooms
review: Pros: Perfect location. Walking distance to town, a stone throw away from train station, small marts and restaurants nearby. Very good and helpful service!  Cons: limited buffet breakfast spread and slightly older rooms but not a big issue for us.

title: Quiet Older Hotel, But Don't Drop The Soap
review: I loved this hotel so much.  My room was very large and comfortable, with a marble-tiled bathroom.  Excellent location, safe and easy to get to, and an excellent breakfast.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Average hotel, friendly staff, housekeeping needs improvement
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Terrible hotel
review: Had booked a quadruple room and stayed here for one night.  The hotel is very close to the SMN train station and about 1km away from the main points of Florence.   First impression, they have the elevator at the road level but, you cannot use it to bring in your luggage to the front desk to check-in, the management needs to do something about it. They take your luggage only after you check-in from where the elevator operates.   If you are traveling with old people or people with mobility problems, please let the hotel know in advance and get a room that does not need to be accessed by stairs.  The rooms were well appointed but, the bathroom flush had a problem and wouldn't work in the morning. The service personnel couldn't fix it and eventually we asked  for a nearby room to be…

title: Amazing stay!
review: I wouldn’t recommend this hotel to anyone, the room was terrible and I found a booger with a nose hair on the wall!!  I was so disgusted, the only thing the manager did was pick it off the wall. We paid for the one night and left without even staying and I regret even giving them money. The room looked nothing like the website and was very bare, except the restroom which for some reason was completely renovated. Maybe they should look into renovating the entire room instead of just the restroom! Such a disappointment, we just went home to Naples from there.  Oh and they said the spots on the wall are “wood” looked more like mold to me.

title: Very comfortable, great locaton
review: Dear kmrosalez, Usually I don’t reply to a subjective review, but I can’t accept that you consider our room very old . I inform you that this room is a suite completely renovated on april 2017 with about 50 square meters of boiserie painted with a very expensive special aging working method that probably you are not aware of. I send many regards to you and to the beautiful town of Naples. Riccardo Ceseri

title: excellent choice
review: We had an amazing stay. The staff was very kind and helpful and we got a free room upgrade. The location is very good near to the city center and near to the train station.  We enjoyed the sauna in the hotel which we had all for ourselves.   The breakfast was the best I ever had in any hotels, delicious!

title: Roomy (triple room), Classic and Central
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: I booked it for a reasonable price and never regreted!
review: Comfortable and spacious room with acceptable street noises, great running hot water, no lunch and dinner service but so many restaurants and trattorias near by, get out and explore, 5pm cocktails was a pleasant relax after a day of shopping, sight seeing and exploring before going out for dinner. Staff were friendly and helpful, both at front desk, restaurant areas and maid service.

title: Close to the train station and good breakfast spread
review: Dear emaxinestrong, Thank you from all the staff for your review, your feedback is very important to us. It is certainly a great reward to read such praising feedback from our valued guests, and we hope for the opportunity to host you again in the near future. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Not Good
review: It was located near the Smooth Hotel where we stayed and I've read of it before coming. My husband and I were here in the late time and after dinner but nevertheless ordered huge waffle cones of  different ice cream. It is not ice cream you know: it is well beaten cream, with all conceivable additions. It could replace a whole dinner! And the price was so "democratic". I read about this hotel in Booking and TripAdvisor and am very much thankful for people who recommended it. Not a budget hotel but it worth money! A very cozy a quiet room , as I asked, Good helpful staff, buffet breakfast and terrific location- less than 5 min by foot with luggage. Very close to all places of sightseeing , never took buses.   Warm in the room and in the bath room . The last one is huge. Towel…

title: Fabulous Hotel
review: Dear Nataliya623, Thank you for posting your feedback after your recent stay with us here at our Hotel I am delighted that you had a good time and  I will certainly share your comments with the team. We look forward to welcoming you back again in the near future. Kind regards. Riccardo Ceseri - General Manger

title: Convenient, "old style" hotel
review: We enjoyed our stay at the Adler Cavalieri.  There were 3 of in the room and it was comfortable.  The staff kept everything very clean and comfortable.  The location was close to the train station which we appreciated, but it was an easy walk to all the sights. There was plenty of food at breakfast, even for our gluten-free person.  Everything tasted terrific too. The staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay very much.

title: Nice little hotel
review: Dear studyabroadmom2010, I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo

title: Location, location, location!
review: We stayed 3 nights here, and found nothing to complain about. The location is within walking distance of the downtown tourist attractions, the breakfast was good (with very attentive wait staff) and the room was good-sized. Also, we went up to the hotel bar 2 evenings, and enjoyed the casual seating and the free appetizers. The house wines were good, and several I our party enjoyed the Aperol Spritzers!    We heard that some friends' rooms had smaller bathrooms, but ours was quite large - and our room opened onto a semi-private courtyard as well.

title: Ideal location
review: Pros: Friendly staff, easy to find, nice breakfast options, comfortable rooms, clean, updated bathrooms. We were on the first floor facing the street, and barely heard any noise.  Cons: Not in the most appealing neighborhood. Very close to the train station, so great to use as a home base if you are doing day trips from Florence. 15-20 minute walk to the main Florence sights.

title: Great Location and Staff
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Rooms a bit Small
review: We very much enjoyed this hotel during our four days in Florence.  It is very close to the train station and the bus station (great for day trips to Siena or Pisa).  They provided a very good breakfast buffet.  I do miss their cappuccino.    The staff were very pleasant and efficient and helped clarify the steps for doing trips to Siena and Pisa.  We stored our luggage there after checkout, and when we came back later that day from Pisa, we were soaked from a rainstorm.  They had sympathy and offered to let us change into dry clothes in the lobby bathrooms before heading to the train station.  We will definitely stay here again during any future visit to Florence.

title: central hotel for business not for leasure
review: Dear Gary S, Thank you for your review, your feedback is very important to us. It is certainly a great reward to read such praising feedback from our valued guests, and we hope for the opportunity to host you again in the near future. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Good position but too old
review: This hotel in the heart of Florence is charming. The bathroom is made from the marble that this rrgion is famous for. The rooms are serviceable  but are quite small; there is not enough room to open two suitcases.

title: Family Holiday
review: Decent place not fancy at all. nice breakfast. old style  but clean rooms.  for a job travel is perfect. for vacation don´t think it is a good option. service is very good and willing to help at all times.

title: Convinient Local & Clean
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Good hotel close to Train Station
review: A hotel located in 5 minutes walking distant from the train station (go out the exit on the right hand side of the platform level), close to the cluster of historic buildings and next door to the bus terminal with service going to one of the outlet malls.  Room is clean, breakfast is good, service is courteous.  It was my second time staying the same hotel.  Will stay there again when next visit Florence.

title: Traditional florence
review: We requested a triple room but were given an apartment in a building beside the hotel.  The apartment was very large - complete with a kitchen, fridge, microwave etc.  Only a 5 minute walk from the train station so in a good area.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.

title: Lovely hotel
review: Dear Marnie R, Thank you from all the staff for taking the time to review your recent stay and for your feedback.  I do hope that we will be able to welcome you back again! Best regards, Riccardo Ceseri

title: Superb hotel
review: A lovely hotel decorated in a traditional way that create an impression of elegance. 5 minutes walk from the railway station andc10 minutes to the attractions of Florence centre. The rooms were very good and had everything we needed. The bar was really good and breakfast was just right for us. All of the staff we talked to were very polite and helpful. Service with a smile on every occasion. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definitely stay again

title: Lovely Stay
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Never Again!
review: I love this hotel. Classic authentic Italian design. Wonderful friendly and helpful staff that all speak excellent English. Very close to the train station and 5 minutes walk from the centre of Florence. Highly recommended. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Nice and good location
review: Dear ScottyApps, I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review and hope to welcome you back again. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo

title: One Night Stay
review: This is a lovely, old hotel and the staff is nice. The location is good. But, if you plan on getting sleep, do NOT stay here! The walls are so thin you can hear the crinkling of plastic bags - no joke. Every room is the same. I would not stay again.

title: Generous hotel with a great breakfast terrace
review: Dear Matt M, I read your review an I answer you with a famous thought «I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it. » Best reagrds. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Central hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Nicest personnel!!
review: The hotel is traditional and comfortable. The staff are friendly and helpful. We had a twin room on the ground floor which was spacious but a little dark and lacked storage space.  Breakfast was good with plenty of choice. The pastries and individual fruit flans were lovely.  The situation is perfect for the train station,  Duomo etc

title: Perfect base camp for a beautiful city
review: Dear 60jule, Thank you for your review. It was our pleasure to have you as our guests, but I would like to comment that i don't understand very much you laud the hotel's services and you rate only 3/5 however I always respect the guest's opinion and I send you my best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Dissapointed
review: Great hotel! The room and bathroom were very spacious and clean. The location is great if you plan on taking the train. Lovely personnel who helped in planning for a day trip for wine tasting. Also, Roberto taught me some Italian sign language (what's up Roberto).  Overall lovely stay but there were two downsides: the wifi and the breakfast. WiFi was in bad shape; it was difficult to maintain a call as the signal was weak and would disconnect after a few minutes. Breakfast was ok just not a lot of variety.  Still give it 5 stars though!! Hope I visit again!

title: A nice hotel with a lot of history
review: Dear  Natalie K, Thank you from all the staff for taking the time to review your recent stay and for your feedback.  I do hope that we will be able to welcome you back again! Best regards, Riccardo Ceseri

title: Quaint hotel close to everything in Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Nice Stay
review: We greatly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Adler Cavalieri.  The hotel's location can't be beat--very near the train station, close to everything in Florence, close to several restaurants, a wonderful piazza with more restaurants and a great gelato store.  On the same block or just around the corner were a small supermarket and other convenience stores and a pharmacy, all very convenient if you don't feel like going too far.   Hotel was very clean and pleasant.  Hotel staff was  friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was in the lower floor of the hotel and you could eat indoors or al fresco, which was very pleasant.  The food consisted of typical continental breakfast--cold cuts, cheeses, breads, cakes, and eggs/sausages.  They served free cold drinks for guests in the lobby seating…

title: Great location & hotel
review: Dear Sophie R, Thank you for choosing Hotel Adler Cavalieri  and for your review, your feedback is important to us. Thank you for your 5-star review. We were thrilled to see that you enjoyed your stay with us to the fullest degree possible It is certainly a great reward to read such praising feedback from our valued guests, and we hope for the opportunity to host you again in the near future to create more good times. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: First time in Florence
review: Centrally located near the center of everything. Just a stones throw away from both the train station and bus station and about 10 minutes from the open air market, Quiet and peaceful with a fairly clean room. The only downside is that the hotel could use a good cleaning. Hand prints here and there and just not thoroughly clean halls doors etc..

title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of florence
review: Friendly staff. Nice clean hotel. Excellent location too, about a 5 minute walk from the Santa Maria novella station & a 5 minute walk from the hotel to the car rental spots; hertz & Avis. Breakfast was also lovely in the morning. I think perhaps some rooms were smoking rooms because at times the corridors smelt a bit like cigarettes. Free wifi at the hotel is also available! :)

title: Very convenient to Florence centre, shopping, dining etc. Nothing special
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: close to train station.
review: If you like to walk to everything, and don't mind being in the middle of all the traffic and noise, the Adler is an O K choice. Its clean with some nice furnishings and a good central location to walk to most attractions and food choices. The Internet was a constant problem, so if you like to "stay in touch" or back up your pictures to a "cloud" there may be some frustration.

title: Venice experience
review: Stayed there for two nights. since I was traveling by train I was looking for a hotel close to the train station and I was not disappointed it was a nice hotel with a very helpful front desk staff they were very nice and friendly. breakfast was good rooms were nice nothing  fancy. to me it did its purpose of accommodation.

title: The hotel has a good location
review: We had a great time in that cute n comfortable hotel . The room was clean and convenient with a nice private terrace the location was great so almost all tourists attractions were between walking distance , and we enjoyed the satisfying breakfast

title: A welcoming hotel
review: The hotel has a good location. it is really close to the airport bus and central railway station and about 10 min walking distance to historic center. hospitable staff. There is a food shop behind the corner

title: Friendly staff, nice rooms and clean
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Mioara
review: We were in Florence for two days and stayed at this hotel due to very close proximity to train station and ability to walk  to multiple attractions. It was decently priced for the good quality. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast was the substantial with meats, cheeses, cereal, pastries, toast and coffee. We do not spend much time in the hotel when traveling so it met out needs wonderfully for a clean and comfortable room, clean bathroom with tub shower and nice breakfast to start off the day.

title: Exquisite hotel and service!
review: This is a  very nice hotel. The beds and pilows are very comfortable. Our room was a good size and quiet. There is a large safe, and wifi was excellent. Breakfast provided a good buffet choice. The location is excellent - very close to the  Train Station. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent hotel in Florence
review: Dear miu2017, I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo

title: The Budget we had it was best hotel we stayed
review: We found the hotel on trip advisor and loved the location. We snagged up a great deal and fell in love with the hotel. The room was great, we just did the standard for the two of us, and it included an awesome shower, minibar, tv, and a cute little view. The hotels breakfast, which is included, was great! Fresh croissants, eggs, bacon, prosciutto, and of course any beverage you can think of. We also took full advantage of the bar and ordered some cappuccino and mixed drinks to end the night. About ten minutes walking distance from all of the attractions. I 10/10 recommend to anyone staying in Florence. As we checked out, they offered to keep our bags in a safe place while we strolled around until our train arrived. We will be back! Thank you all for such incredible service and a…

title: Lovely stay
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Nice hotel
review: We booked this hotel based on reviews and location to the train station which was the way we arrived It is a very short block from the station and we found it easily dragging our luggage ( again and as always too much ) behind us  From the hotel you can walk anywhere in the city and not become too tired or disoriented because the central core which is the most interesting area is not all that large   The room was spacious and well decorated  and the morning buffet was very very good    Would definitely return

title: Staff very accommodating.
review: Dear Allan D, Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review and  I am so glad you enjoyed it, and we hope to have you back someday. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Charming hotel
review: This is a nice hotel. The beds are firm but comfortable. Our room was a good size (though the bathroom was compact) and quiet. There is a large safe, and wifi was excellent. Breakfast provided a good buffet choice. The ceilings have a lovely ornate design (very Italian :-)). The location is excellent - very close to shopping and a train station. I would stay here again.

title: Great hotel near Santa Maria Novella Square and Train Station
review: Room spacious and clean.  near subway system and places to eat.  can't write anymore sorry.  I stayed as part of a tour group and most people agreed with my feelings about this hotel.  It was a nice coffee bar as well.

title: A Lovely Hotel near the Train Station
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Inexpensive & Great Location
review: I was very pleased with this hotel. It is close to the train station, which was a key factor for me, yet has none of the traffic or noise that you might associate with that location. (Florence is small enough that I didn't feel far from any site.) My single room was spacious, with great A/C and a nice view of the garden and distant buildings. The bathroom was large and well-equipped. My bed was very comfortable. I used the fitness room in the basement only once, but it was a tight fit with the equipment. I chose to simply run along the Arno, and recommend that! The breakfast was delicious, and I liked having the option of eating in the garden. All in all, a great stay and I'd recommend this hotel.

title: 2 nights in Florence
review: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Adler Cavalieri for 4 nights as part of our first trip to Italy. We took the train from Venice to Florence, and were very happy that we booked a hotel so close to the train station. We rolled our luggage over to the hotel, and were instantly greeted by the staff. Our room was ready even though we were early, and everyone was very friendly. The room was very clean and actually quite big (especially in comparison to other European hotels where I have stayed). The bed was very comfortable, and they serviced our room every day with clean towels and a clean room. We really enjoyed the breakfast that they offered: cereals, yogurts, fruit, scrambled eggs, meats, cheeses, delicious croissants, small donuts, and great coffee! One evening, we even…

title: Gorgeous hotel, fantastic staff
review: Hotel was very close and convenient walk to train station. Able to walk anywhere in Florence. Hotel was very clean and had a lovely breakfast. Concierge staff was very kind and helpful to answer any questions or make recommendations

title: Hidden Gem.
review: Dear Pfrankle, I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo

title: Great hotel, great location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Loved this hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. It is in a convenient location (metres from the train station) and the hotel itself is stunning.   One slight issue we had, our toilet was constantly running which was a slight nuisance. I informed reception but nothing was done about it.   Besides that minor issue the room was comfortable, really spacious, clean and visually pleasing.   The breakfast was the best i have had so far and the staff were all super friendly and spoke great english.   Would certainly stay there again and recommend them as a good choice to explore Florence.

title: I liked it
review: We stayed in room 214. A lovely quiet room with a balcony away from hallways. Breakfast was excellent and the cold iced tea in the sitting room was lovely after a hot afternoon of walking. Hotel is within walking distance of most attractions like the duomo, markets, uffizi gallery, churches etc. Very close to train  station. Staff all very friendly and helpful. Loved the Adler Cavalieri and would stay here again. Can't think of one negative comment. 5 stars....

title: Good stay here
review: Dear lynne899, Thank you for your review. It was our pleasure to have you as our guests and when should you be back in Florence, please feel free to contact us. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Wonderful hotel
review: The location is very good. Not in the heart of old city but can reach there very soon by walk. Reception is warm and friendly. Breakfast is very good for a 4-star hotel. Our room was small but acceptable. The only negative point i mentioned that the shower box is very small and all the time water spread over the bath floor and even into the room. Finally I recommend it to my friends.

title: First Class treatment
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Excellent Hotel - Ideal stay in Florence
review: The hotel was easy suitcase-dragging distance from the main bus/coach/train station. By chance the best restaurant that we visited during our stay, Trattoria Dall'Oste was just opposite the station only 150 metres/yards away from the hotel. The hotel was one of several positiuoned on the Easyjet we-page. Never trusting in-your-face adverts I checked external reviews first and took the plunge. I received huge praise from the members of my family for my 'inspired choice'. Not deserved of course but it really was. The rooms were clean and nicely fitted. The two sets of windows were double-glazed so there was no noice from the street. The air-coditioning was silent but effective. The shower/toilet rooms differed in size. Ours wasa the smallest but all were very modern and clean. We…

title: Old hotel needs refreshment and rennovation
review: Dear Alan S, Thank you for posting a charming review of your stay at our Hotel. We enjoyed reading your kind words and compliments, it certainly sounds like you had a nice stay and had the opportunity to experience many of the fine facilities that the hotel has to offer.  We very much appreciate your recommendation and look forward to the pleasure of welcoming you back to stay with us very soon. Kind regards, Riccardo Ceseri

title: Nice stay
review: Stayed here a couple of weeks ago.  Lovely hotel - nothing I would change / complain about. Perfect location - just around the corner from the bus and train station, so ideal if arriving there with luggage, and handy for transport for days out around the region. Lots of good places to eat and drink nearby, and just 15 mins walk to central attractions.  We had a room on 3rd floor looking onto courtyard - there was minimal traffic noise with window open, and silence with window shut.  The room was a good size twin / double, nice bath / shower room, good air con to keep room cool,  kettle and hot drinks in room and mini-bar fridge. Breakfast was great - a good selection of cereals, fruit, breads, meats, cheese, eggs, pastries and cakes.  You could either eat inside or at tables…

title: Location superb!
review: Dear Amy G, Thank you for sharing your review of our Hotel. It was a pleasure to read your your kind words on our attentive staff.. I do hope to welcome you back to Adler Cavalieri very soon again. With kind regards, Riccardo Ceseri

title: Kareen Zaatar
review: Had recent 5day stay in fabulous little hotel Adler Cavalieri. Perfect "ye olde world" hotel with such attention to detail. Lovely breakfast, served either indoor or on outdoor patio.  Close to Train St  SMN, for trip to Pisa.  sightseeing, eateries. shopping, or just sitting on one of the many Piazzas with coffee or vino, watching the world go by  A BIG "thank you" to all the very helpful staff.  Will certainly recommend the Adler to friends and family. and would love to return to wonderful Tuscany.

title: Great Little Hotel and Great Location!
review: I thank you very much for your beautiful review and when should you be back in Florence, please feel free to contact us. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Great Hotel in Historic Florence
review: I traveled to Italy with my husband for tourism. We stayed in Florence for 3 days and it was at Adler Cavalieri. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and we had free access to powerful wifi. The location of the hotel is excellent; close to monuments and shopping. However, I was very disappointed from too many other things. The breakfast was terrible; very poor! They didn't have a variety of food and the place where they display the food is very small, doesn't fit much quantity. It was a disaster! But to tell the truth the pastry was delicious. Other than that, the mattresses were not comfortable at all. The mirrors in the lift and the hallways were very old and stained; not out of dirt but out of age! I don't really recomment the stay at this hotel and I…

title: Excellent hotel
review: Dear Kareen S. Z, I read your review, but I don't understand why your stay was so orrible, but I don't answer to  a subjective judgement, because I haven't any answer if you don't like our mirror in the lift. I want only to point out that you assign the same score to one of the most important italian monument (Ponte Vecchio) and I'm very proud to be in the same company. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Wonderful!
review: The hotel is good. Great location close to the train station and also the duomo. The hotel ia very clean. The rooms are tidy with shiny floor and the ceiling of the rooms are painted. The breakfast is very average i personnaly hated it

title: Adler Cavaliere
review: Well priced, convenient to train and sights, friendly staff, 24-hr service, great little bar area, terrific breakfast included, and super cute well-appointed rooms. Honeymoon stay, they made sure to give us a balcony room too 😊  Tip: Google image the walk from the train station to the hotel. It's literally across the street and around the corner. Took us less than two minutes.

title: Clean, Quiet & Maintained
review: Dear nhenre_672548, Thank you for your review. It was our pleasure to have you as our guests! We are glad to have made your honeymoon a memorable one and hope to welcome you back again. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: This hotel is great
review: Very comfortable hotel.Hotel staff are very helpful and humble. Situated Very close to Florence S.M.N station. Good ambiance neat and clean Rooms and common areas. Close by to all attractions. Breakfast is ok, could have been better. Hotel staff also organises Local Tours Nd sightseen.

title: Good
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Old and not maintained
review: The hotel is good. Clean, but old. The location is great, you can do everything walking. The breakfast was okay, but could have more fruits and options.  They have a parking but you have to pay 22 euros per day.  The room was acceptable, old but clean. The air conditioner was broken.

title: Location and elegance
review: Dear Camilaconte, I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo

title: Excellent Location
review: It's breakfast was acceptable, it has a beautiful yard and it has a parking. But I think if you don't need parking, its beter to find another place. Especially it's not clean. For first time in my trips, I couldn't use towels and bedsheets, because they weren't clean. It has a very poor Internet connection which only can be used in ground floor and we had to use or mobile data program, instead. It's location was acceptable; but you can find better hotels in better location with appropriate price.

title: Lovely hotel & rooms with private garden in balcony
review: The Hotel Adler Cavalieri was an excellent place to stay. The staff is extremely helpful with reservations, taxis, directions and any other requests My husband is handicapped and our room was perfect for our needs. The breakfast was good as well. Great location and old style charm - highly recommend!

title: A very good choice
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: The best hotel on the trip!
review: It is not easy to find a hotel with a traditional feel without it being dated or shabby. So the Adler Cavalieri came as a very pleasant surprise. From the outside it is unobtrusive but from the moment of entering I felt welcome by the desk staff. The room was spacious with everything I look for in a hotel. The bed linen was white and crisp without the dreaded bedspread, and yes, there was an electric kettle with an array of beverages. A short trip to the bar yielded a small jug of milk (free) and I felt at home for the first time during the trip around Italy.  The room was air conditioned, had a bolt to secure the room from the inside and the cupboard contained a safe. There was a flat screen tv opposite the bed. The window opened and though there was not much of a view, this…

title: Three days in Beautiful Florence
review: We stayed in 3 different cities, Rome, Florence, and Venice and obviously 3 different hotels.  This was the best of the 3.  Spacious, great bed, convenient, very attractive hotel, and very nice service - nice breakfast as well.  We tried to find nice hotels that didn't completely break the bank.  This one was an absolute winner!  It's not right next to any major attractions, but Florence is a good walking city, you can pretty much walk to everything from here. It's right around the corner from the train station, but I never noticed any noise.  There are some great restaurants within a block. There is also a coin laundry right next store which was very convenient - and needed on the second leg of our trip.  I would highly recommend this hotel.  It's a great pick. You will not be…

title: Combining business with pleasure
review: Dear TK_DC, There are no words to thank you for your beautiful review,  I do hope that we will be able to welcome you back again very soon! Best regards, Riccardo Ceseri

title: Historic elegant central hotel
review: We had a pleasant stay at the quiet, friendly, homely ambiance  of the Cavalieri.  The hotel is situated close to the station and outer circumference of Florence and within easy walking distance of the main attractions.  Vibrant cosy slippers and a small box of Biscotti biscuits await your arrival as you enter the rustically decorated bedroom/ bathroom. All very clean and well presented. The breakfast is of continental style, offering, juices, cereals, fruit, cheese, cold meats, eggs, bread and patisseries. There's also a small section of cereals, pastries and cakes suitable for gluten free diets.  There's a Conad supermarket close by and it's worth visiting the first floor of the market. Here they serve a variety of delicious meals, suitable for most palates. Especially good…

title: Old world hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great location, friendly staff, excellent stay!
review: LOVE this hotel in the middle of Florence!!! Rooms are comfortable & old world style- just beautiful. ( However, bed was very comfortable but pillows were HORRIBLE!!!!!   ).  Hot pot for tea or coffee in the room!! Breakfast was one of the prettiest & hardiest in all of Italy so far!!! Front desk Staff spoke English which is always helpful. We would gladly stay here again!!

title: Excellent hotel in great location!
review: Really enjoyed our stay at the Adler, the staff were friendly, welcoming and helpful and the hotel itself was very authentic, a good mix of authenticity with modern comfort. The location is great about 8 minutes walk to the Duomo and the main city centre. The bar is very nice to sit outside after a long day of walking and the bartender was chatty and welcoming. I would love to go back to Florence soon and when I do, I'll be booking here again!

title: Good location
review: Dear Froogle89, Thank you for choosing Hotel Adler Cavalieri  and for your review, your feedback is very important to us. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Nice hotel in perfect location!
review: We stayed here for 5 nights attending a conference. The room was very comfortable, the bathroom was updated, clean and the water was hot. The staff was very friendly and helpful, always greeting us with a smile. It was minutes from the train stations and walking distance to most major attractions. The breakfast was substancial but I don't think they serve lunch or dinner, but the staff made great recommendations to restaurants close by. The lounge is comfortable with snacks in the afternoon. The bartender was delightful. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Lovely, comfortable place to stay.
review: We were thrilled with our decision to stay here!  Great location, as we came into Florence on the train, and easy walk into the city.  All the absolutes, ie: good bed, clean, hot water(!) but also a great Italian feel, from the traditional decor, very friendly staff, and seriously good breakfast!

title: An accessible oasis in the middle of Florence
review: Dear Kathy W, thanks so much for sharing a review with us, and how lovely to hear that you had a good time you stayed with us. I do hope that we will be able to welcome you back again very soon! Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Good location for Eurail travellers
review: We were traveling with a group and most everyone was happy with their room. We had a first floor room that looked out onto a courtyard that's very pretty. The room was a nice size, bed was comfortable and front desk was very helpful. The breakfast was very good with many options. Always left full. The service was incredible. There is a bar upstairs that we didn't go to except to get ice. We went out one night and felt quite safe. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: An enjoyable stay.
review: Dear Saloude1, Thank you for choosing Hotel Adler Cavalieri  and for your beautiful review, your feedback is important to us. It was our pleasure to have you as our guests and hope to welcome you back again. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Good hotel, great location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great staff, Great location
review: A 5 min walk from the main station. This is a great little hotel within walking distance of almost everything. Staff speak excellent English, check was super quick, and a nice well appointed room. breakfast was decent too

title: Nice hotel in a convenient location
review: We were traveling with a group of almost 50 people. They staff were very  accommodating  and helpful. Matteo was especially helpful in helping with a group get together. The breakfast staff were excellent providing great coffee and a smiling face to start our day. Many thanks. When we return this will be our destination.

title: A walking tour of Florence
review: Our family had 2 rooms and had a wonderful stay while visiting our daughter who was studying in Florence. It's conveniently located 2 minutes from the train station and a 15 minute walk to all the major sites. Great buffet breakfast and friendly staff.

title: Wonderful stay in Florence complimented by this charming hotel
review: The hotel is walking distance to both the Accademia and Uffizi museums and has many restaurants within blocks of it. The room was clean and the staff was very accommodating, especially Matteo. A very pleasant experience.

title: Great stay
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great location to stay in Firenze!
review: Excellent rooms. Wonderful location which was so convenient to the train station and near all the sights. Good restaurants nearby and many more within easy walking distance.  Delicious breakfast and the staff was very helpful.  Overall great stay.

title: Great location with a great buffet breakfast!
review: Dear DrKenRam, Thank you for your review, your feedback is important to us and when should you be back in Florence, please feel free to contact us. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: My Tuscan home away from home
review: Our stay at the Adler Cavalieri has been wonderful.  Its location is literally a 2-3 minute walk from Santa Maria Novella Bus/Train Station.  Everything is easily accessible by foot, which is what we used to get around in Florence.  From this great hotel you can be in the city centre after a 10 minute walk.  The daily breakfast included in the room rate was superb. You have quite a few choices from meats & pastries, to jams and yummy deserts.  The coffee they make is even better!  All the staff was very helpful and welcoming.  The only thing I would add is we believed it was more of a 3 - 3.5 star hotel based on the interior of the rooms and of the building, rather than a 4 star as it is mentioning to be.  Despite this, we enjoyed our time spent here!

title: Classic Italian Hotel!
review: Lovely hotel located near the train station. (5 mins walk)  Great location as it is only 10-15 mins walk to Duomo.  Spacious rooms with a log cabin feel to it! Comes with bath tubs and radiator towel racks where you can dry your clothes!  Reminded me of old hotels in the movies but in a very good way! If you leave your card key inside, they will lend u a hotel room key that even comes with a tassle that is jst so nostalgic!  Breafast selection was complete and delectable! Try the fruit tarts! Oh sooo yummy!!

title: Elegant hotel in a good locations
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Loved our stay!
review: Lovely large room, very clean.  The reception were very helpful and breakfast was good.  Nice bar downstairs.  The location was perfect and safe to walk about with plenty of restaurants nearby.  Easy walk to main square and the Duomo

title: Charming and central
review: The Adler is a wonderful hotel and our room was lovely.  The location is ideal for touring the highlights of Florence and it is less than a 5 minute walk to the train station.  The staff was very courteous and the front desk was always willing to help with booking reservations for restaurants or ordering tickets for the galleries.   Our favorite hotel luxury was the breakfast which included many fresh, healthy options.  The fruits, eggs, potatoes, meats and fabulous bakery items were a great way to start our day.  Dining room staff provided friendly service and were hard working.  Our room was spacious and included tons of storage space.  The slippers and the big bathtub were a bonus!  We hope to return to Florence and would definitely stay again at the Adler.

title: Bad road, nice hotel
review: Dear brendawD1197OB, Thank you for your review. It was our pleasure to have you as our guests! We are glad to have made your stay a pleasant one and hope to welcome you back again. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: A good hotel near city center of Florence
review: A nice and comfortable stay at this Hotel. Very clean room and comfortable matresses. At first we were in Large room with balcony but temperature was too cold for me and straight away the receptionist found us an other room, smaller but warmer. Very helpful staff. Breakfast room was cosy, the waiter was very polite and the breakfast choice was large and fresh. The location is good as we can walk everywhere very easy. Perfect stay. Thank you. We highly recommend it.

title: Good Hotel at Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Not too bad, not too good. No particular impression remained.
review: The hotel is located a street behind the Main Train Station, just a 3 minites walk. This hotel is a relatively old-styled with old furniture and old designs, but it doesn't mean that it is dirty. The room is clean and the toilet is clean.  Staffs are friendly. Breakfast with enough choices and good coffee. Wifi is not strong but is acceptable for normal use.

title: Florence
review: Averageness seems to be the best description of this hotel. The main entrance is narrow and wasn't striking from the exterior. If you unpack your bags from the car, you'll disturb people walking on the pavement. The same if you wait for a taxi. Just behind the automatic door, there are few stairs, quite difficult to force by disabled people.  The reception area is quite dark. The staff was not too enthousiastic about guests, they look bothered rather. Elevators, like all the building, were worn-out; level marks were hardly visible.  The room has clear musty odour. While is was superficially clean, the signs of many years of usage were numerous.  Breakfast was poor, and menu was too scanty. It is difficult to explain there was no regional cheeses in a heart of Tuscany; I found…

title: Excellent value!
review: Hotel Adler was a very nice hotel...   Older, but well maintained.   This hotel is well located to the river, bridges, churches, museums, etc--as all seem to be within 10 minutes walks.  If you coming via bus or rail, it's a 5 minute walk to this hotel.. Their breakfast (included in the room price) was very nice---large layout of a variety of cold meats, bakery, eggs, coffee, juice, etc.  and a wait staff to help with the tables.  The main desk staff was very friendly and helpful!!    Location Location, & Location---stay here!!

title: lovely hotel
review: Dear Tommy K, I thank you very much and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo

title: Good location and helpful staff
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great stay in central Florence
review: I gave up buying the museum ticket after one hour waiting outside the museum without any move...then I told the receptionist of the hotel that I was having problem booking ticket in the museum website as everything is in Italian... she called the museum directly for booking a ticket for me immediately!!! Thank you so much

title: Great Hotel
review: I thank you for choosing our Hotel and I should also like to thank you for your review. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo

title: Great stay
review: This hotel was fantastic. It was located very close to the major train station, some great restaurants (the receptionist pointed me to one that was utterly fantastic!), and is about a 5-10 minute walk depending on your pace to the Florence Duomo. On the way there there is another church with a pretty facade called the Basilica di Santa Maria Novella.   The room was clean and quite well spaced up on the 3rd floor (303 I think?). It was decorated in a more traditional style than modern style, but it felt quite homey. The only minor thing about the room is that in the bathroom the shower is quite small, barely enough room to turn around in without knocking the shower fittings. I'm a 5'9' woman and it felt cramped for me, I feel sorry for anyone who is taller than that trying to use…

title: Constructive Criticism
review: Lovely Hotel. Not far from St Maria Novell train station(few minutes) Beautiful helpful staff. Very good breakfast. The rooms are a little on the small size, but very clean. Bathroom was spotless. I have stayed at the Alder 4 times now, and I find it great for Restaurant's, train, buses, and close to all the beautiful attractions of Florence. They can also help you with organising Day trips to Tuscany & Cinque Terre, ect.

title: A very comfortable stay
review: Lovely hotel, room was clean and a good size bed sheets changed every day. Very good breakfast,helpful reception staff, 10min walk to the centre of Florence and 4 min walk from the train station. Plenty of restaurants nearby.

title: Great hotel for Florence touring
review: I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo

title: A gem
review: Had a week here at the end of July and really enjoyed staying in the Adler. Clean, very helpful staff,  excellent breakfasts, air con, wifi. Lots of good restaurants and bars nearby, and the station just around the corner which made catching the bus back to the airport easy.

title: Wonderful stay
review: I thank you very much for your beautiful review and when should you be back in Florence, please feel free to contact us. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Nice rooms, but horrible front desk
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Good location
review: This hotel could have been a wonderful place to stay.  The location was great and easy to get anywhere from.  The rooms were nicely decorated in antique furnishings and a nice size.  My major complaints were the temperature of the rooms and the service we received was horrifying.  Do not stay here if the weather is very hot.  Unfortunately, while we spent the 2 nights, it was over 100 degrees in Florence.  When they say the have air conditioning, it is a lie.  The coolest our room got was 78 degrees.  Hardly a cool room and after being in the heat all day and night, we just wanted to get some sleep in a comfortable room. That did not happen, it was miserable.  The night front desk clerk was probably the worst person I have ever come in contact with at a hotel.  His name was…

title: Excellent location next to SMN train station
review: I am very sorry about your stay in our hotel, because a unsatisfied guest is our personal failure, but I would like to point out that the temperature in Florence downtown during your stay was 40°/41°, the media told that last month was the hottest july from 1950 and in your room was 25°, a very big difference of 15°/16° from outside. I should like to add that you need need to take care with your words, because you are calling us liars about air conditioning, but above all you are calling a person a pervert, and you wrote "if this was an hotel in USA...", I tell you if we were in USA, not you but our front desk clerk would have gone to the police after your great insulte. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo

title: Nice Hotel
review: This was a lovely hotel in a great location. The staff were helpful and the breakfast was varied and pleasant as there was an outdoor area. There was even a nice little bar up on the first floor . I enjoyed my stay here.

title: Nice hotel, good service
review: I thank you very much for your beautiful review and when should you be back in Florence, please feel free to contact us. Beste regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Lucky find!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: excellent hotel, convenient location and friendly staff
review: This place was a lucky find we think, having received an apparently good deal through a booking website.  Easy to find, very close proximity to the train station, yet removed enough to be away from the major pedestrian traffic at the station. It is also within easy walking distance of all the major sites in the city centre region.   The rooms are small, on par with Italy in general. The bed was very comfortable. Our room also included breakfast, which consisted of a buffet spread of cheese, meats, fruit, breads, with eggs and sausages also available.   The bathroom had great lightning and the shower was good.   If we had to give any criticisms about this place, the wifi was patchy, and inconsistent and slow when it was available. Special mention to Roberto, who was excellent at…

title: Excellent place to stay in Florence
review: You can walk to everything from this hotel which is located close to the main station which we found convenient for arrival by train and departure to Pisa Airport by bus.  The hotel was excellent.  Staff were helpful and friendly, the room comfortable and the breakfast was very good with lots of choice.  We would certainly recommend this hotel to friends.

title: The property is in a great location to get around downtown
review: I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo

title: Convenient location
review: This hotel which is 5 minutes walk from SMN train station is a tranquil haven in the heart of the city.  We were sceptical as to how relaxing and quiet it would be when we arrived and saw it situated on a busy road but it was superbly client,  quaint and comfortable,  with lovely friendly staff and an excellent breakfast.  15 minutes walk to Duomo and 20 minutes to Ponte Vecchio is an ideal location.  Andrea on reception was particularly patient and helpful when he assisted us in booking some trips with Ciao Florence and Florence Town.  In the evening there is a finger buffet in the bar which is great for accompanying a lovely Chianti.  Excellent hotel,  great location.

title: A classy stay

title: Comfortable hotel
review: Loved the oldy-woldy wood panelled bedrooms; amazing continental breakfast; ecenong snacks and tea on the veranda.  Easy to walk into central Florence and close to train station for day trips. A great stay all round.

title: Nearly Excellent
review: I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo

title: OK hotel near the train station
review: The hotel room was spacious, especially after visiting hotels in Venice. The location was convenient from the station. They also had the Turkish steam room with reasonable prices. It would be nice if I could enjoy it after a day's trip. However, it was closed fairly early.

title: Cozy comfort in Florence
review: I thank you very much for your beautiful review and when should you be back in Florence, please feel free to contact us. Beste regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: VERY NICE!
review: The Adler Cavalieri is an old style hotel, of which there are still many in Florence.  Lots of dark wood, heavy curtains, watercolours of Florence and ornate light fittings.  The location is good, just 5 minutes walk from the station and Piazza Santa Maria Novella.  The bathroom was simple but clean and the air conditioning was very efficient. Breakfast is good and the staff are helpful and friendly. We got it for a very low price via a corporate booking and were very pleasantly surprised at the room standard considering the price. Not a 5 star hotel, but I would happily stay here again.

title: Friendly atmosphere
review: Hotel stuff was very kind and helpful. Everything was perfect, except cold water pressure in shower. Very hard to get right temperature (it was too hot). Wi-Fi slow, but working... Breakfast very good, many options... If you like cappuccino they will make it for you...

title: Great pace to stay in Florence
review: I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo Managing Director

title: great stay
review: We spended four days/three nights in Florence and in this hotel. Have to say that the personnel in reception is friendly and helpful. I could make the flight check-in through internet a day before our departure, e-mail it to the hotel's address and thence had it in the print, convenient. The hotel has a functioning wifi, albeit quite slow, but still functioning.  The breakfest personnel was stern, but ok. They did not salute us in any morning, when we arrived to the breakfast room, as the personnel in the reception did every morning. Breakfast was very good and the breakfast room was nice and clean, there is a possibility to eat Your breakfast even outside in the small yard. The April weather did not allow us to make it happen. The only drawback in the breakfast was complete…

title: Great Hotel/Dog friendly
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Great staff, location and breakfast
review: We really enjoyed our stay at the Adler Cavalieri. The room was comfortable and clean, the staff exceptionally friendly and helpful with very good english!  Our small dog was welcomed and felt at ease. The breakfast was good and varied. The hotel is in a very convenient location, walking distance to the train station and most of the sights. We would definitely recommend this hotel, and would stay here again!

title: Great stay in Florence
review: I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo

title: Kindness first
review: The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room and bathroom were very spacious.  The breakfast was wonderful. They even had a work out room.  And being so close to the train station was very convenient with our luggage, but we were also able to walk to all the sites in Florence from this location.  My only complaint was that the television had no English channels.

title: I love the big room.
review: The Hotel Adler Cavalieri is terrific.  The location is close to all the major sites of Florence and the staff were wonderful.  We will stay here again the next time we are lucky enough to visit Florence.

title: Wonderful Center City accomodation
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace.
