title: Mis-marketed / Over priced
review: Just got back from my trip to Italy and stayed two nights at Adler Cavalieri.  Wonderful accomodation.  Reasonably priced, clean, comfortable and close to all the attractions. A must do in downtown Florence.

title: Good service and decent stay!!
review: I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo Managing Director

title: Poor comfort
review: While travelling by train through Italy, we booked this hotel as the closest hotel to the train station with a spa. We paid way over the odds for the hotel for these reasons. The spa is very poor, a sauna in a cold basement of the hotel. The hotel cost almost as much as a 5 star hotel in central Rome with exellant spa facilities. The room was poor.  Literally falling apart.  When I took part of the door frame, with nails attached, to reception I was told that the hotel a was living building, these things happen.  This is a budget hotel near the station and the centre of town. This is not a four star hotel with spa facilities.

title: Great hotel and friendy people
review: Dear Stuart S., sincerely your review does not deserve any comment, because you and us know the truth. But I suggest  you next time to insert a complete review and do not forget to write that you entered into the sauna without authorization when other guests were inside, that  you have not paid the sauna service because we donated you, that you don’t know  roman and  florentine Hotel prices for the night of December 31st. Besides, the carpenter, who repaired the door frame, told us that only a person could break it  and  it didn't fall accidentally. Your room number was # 312 and we are at complete disposal if any Tripadvisor’s member would like to see it. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo

title: Great place to stay
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great location for walking around Florence
review: Very friendly staff, great rooms and brilliant location. Going there feels like a step back in time, partly because it is so tranquil, partly as it is a little 1970s, but we loved our stay and the character this place had.

title: Great Location
review: Very nice hotel in walking distance to all of central Florence.  Hotel front desk staff was very courteous and made great recommendations for places to eat.  My initial room had a minor problem and a room change was made without hesitation.  Very good breakfast is included.

title: Good hotel in Florence
review: This hotel is located very close to the train station as well as all of the major attractions of Florence.  The rooms were fine for what we needed.  The hotel staff was very helpful and directed us where we needed to go.  Their English was excellent!  The elevators were a bit scary and old, but that's okay.  Breakfast was very good and they had a huge selection of different things.  The location is also close to many restaurants.  I would stay here again!

title: Good Location quality a below average
review: The hotel is nice, a bit old but all the buildings in Florence are old. I think it's a bit overpriced but this is Florence. The room was ok, not very warm but we were not cold either. The shower area could have been more clean but let's say it was acceptable. The breakfast was ok.

title: Good location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: excellent for a short visit
review: if travel by train, after arrival , there are two main exits from the rail road station, one on the right side and  another on the left side. to the hotel take exit on the right, 5 min. to walk to the hotel

title: Perfect location
review: I thank you very much for your beautiful review and when should you be back in Florence, please feel free to contact us. Beste regards. Riccardo Ceseri

title: Nice place
review: The hotel is very well located. Having travelled by bus from Pisa, the hotel was just 5 minutes walk from the station. You can walk to all Florence tourists attractions and the old city centre (if you can find your way through the many small and narrow streets).  The room was big and clean and the staff was friendly. The breakfast room was small but went at different times and always managed to find a seat. It was a very good experience overall.  Please note that irons and ironing is not allowed in the rooms. There are no coffee/tea facilities in the room (who needs this in Italy when you can get your espresso anywhere for 1.20 Euro?) and you need to pay a deposit if you want a second key.

title: September 2014 holiday
review: Adler is an excellent place to stay in Florence. 5 mins walk to the train station and only a bit further to the historic heart.  Very comfortable rooms. Mine was a single and had all of the charm and elegance you would expect in Florence. Bathroom was modern and up to date. And most of all the hotel was very clean and well maintained.  Staff are very good, especially in the restaurant at breakfast. That jug if steamed milk & fresh coffee is a great way to start the day.  Spent the end of the day relaxing with a chianti in the bar upstairs.  Would definitely return.

title: OK place, but won't knock your socks off
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Nice hotel
review: The Adler Cavalieri was the second of the three hotels we stayed at in Italy and it fell right in the middle as far as comfort. It's an ok place, not elaborate.  The rooms are clean and a bit larger than what we had in Rome.  That means we could both get into the bathroom at the same time. You may be wondering after these statements why it got four stars.  It's because the staff was very helpful to me when I came down with a cold and sinus infection by the time we got to Florence.  They called a doctor who made a house call to the hotel within 90 minutes.  If you are from the states you will find that amazing, but it really did happen so they get an extra star for that. The breakfast room is charming and there is plenty of choices.  The hotel doesn't look like much from the…

title: Rude Employees, Money stolen, Inconvenient location
review: After having a bitter experience in Rome on my hotel (probably because I was keeping my expectations high) Adler Cavalieri was heaven for me. Located near to the railway hub and with efficient front office desk, neat and well maintained rooms, nice breakfast and room service, I am impressed with the hotel.

title: Charming hotel walking distance to the Duomo.
review: I stayed here last month for 3 days while in Florence. The hotel itself is located near the train station but quite a walk to the center of the City near the Ponte Vechhio/ Duomo etc. We did not feel very safe walking back to the hotel late at night because of how far it was.  We had $500 cash stolen from us on our first night there and when it was brought up to the hotel staff there was NO compensation made at all. Instead we were made to feel like it was our fault the money was gone or that " it must have been misplaced" ( which it wasnt). The staff told us we could make a police report, but that nothing would come of it.  I would not recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Florence that places priority on safety, location, or reliability.

title: Average Hotel
review: We accept all complaints and bad reviews that we consider suggestions to improve ourselves, but we will never accept that someone accuse us of being thieves, all the rooms have an electronic safe with personal code, all the openings and closings are recorded, because we have electronic locks connected to a computer and after our inspection we did not detect anything.  I remember very well the situation and You write that the staff was rude, because for you a well polite receptionist had to tell you: Yes we have stolen your money and we give you $ 500,00 !!!!  Honestly, I'm finding that Trip Advisor is becoming a place where some people write what they want even offending the dignity of others, I am very sorry but I can’t accept it,  there are moral and legal limits for everybody.

title: excellent hotel!!!
review: Excellent hotel and big room with very good reception staff and helpfull they give my cheek late till  free of charge because of my train departure to Rome was at night I love the hotel and they give me room with lovely terrace to the garden and if I will back to Florence shore I will stay their again

title: Beautiful Florence!
review: I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards.  Ceseri Riccardo

title: Good hotel with a nice location
review: Good hotel with a nice location - easy just walk 5 - 10 minutes from the railwaystation/airportbus. The personnell is very helpful and they even understood my italian language!! MiIlle Grazie!! The breakfast was good, not just "continental breakfast". Room was large enough and it was very clean and the bathroom was

title: First Class in Everyway
review: I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo

title: Florence
review: Staff at this hotel are excellent, extremely helpful, nothing was too much trouble.  We had a 4 night stay in July in a Classic Room and we were very impressed with the cleanliness. The Buffet Breakfast was.delightful,  Just 250mts to Santa Maria Novella Rail Station makes it so convenient if you are coming into Florence by trail. Also very close into the centre of the city, only a 3 or 4 minute walk.  The hotel is also very close to the Hop-on Hop-off Bus which stops near the station, there are also many restaurants, cafes and bars close by.  An added bonus is that there is a Laundry about 20 meters from the hotel which is extremely useful when travelling.  Overall this hotel is Clean, convenient in a good location.

title: Loved it
review: I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards.  Ceseri Riccardo

title: Location and Quality
review: This is a lovely hotel which is a 5 minute walk to train station. The hotel itself is excellent with lovely air conditioned rooms.The breakfast is buffet style and has everything you could ever want. You can eat in or if it is nice weather there is an outdoor terrace area to sit and have your breakfast which is lovely.The staff are friendly and very helpful and pleasant.Florence is a lovely city and well worth a visit. Would definately reccommend this hotel you can walk everywhere from hotel as everrything is close by.

title: Wonderful stay!
review: I thank you very much for your beautiful review and when should you be back in Florence, please feel free to contact us. Beste regards.  Riccardo Ceseri

title: Friendliest Hotel on our Tour
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Enjoyable Stay in Great Location
review: We spent two nights at the Adler Cavalieri and enjoyed our stay. The buffet breakfasts were excellent, the room, while small was clean and very comfortable. And the staff here was the friendliest of any hotel on our trip. It's location was perfect for for walking around part of Florence that was not on our tour path. And the postcards we left at the front desk actually made it to the people we mailed them to. Postcards left at the front desk of another hotel (to be reviewed later) disappeared and never made it to their addressees. All in all, Adler Cavalieri is a very nice hotel to stay at in Florence  ,

title: A most wonderful hotel!
review: This hotel was quite good and definitely earned their 4 stars. We were given a quiet room in the back as requested (the street in front is rather noisy) and the room was spacious and comfy. Nice friendly staff and great breakfast with friendly, accommodating breakfast room staff. Within walking distance of all the places we wanted to visit, good restaurants and great gelato shops (and train station since we travelled by train).

title: Conveniently close-by
review: I thank you very much for your beautiful review and when should you be back in Florence, please feel free to contact us. Beste regards. Riccardo Ceseri Managing Director

title: Nice location
review: We enjoyed this hotel very much. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms clean and comfortable! We would stay in this Hotel again. Close to everything,shopping,restaurants,metro. You get what you pay for! I recommend this hotel very much.

title: Trip to Firenze
review: We liked everything.Lovely ,romantic hotel with historical sense,friendly ,helpful staff.Nice room,bed linen was changed every day, tasty breakfast. Great location, close to train station with walking distance to main attractions.   Anita@Andris from Latvia

title: Very good classic hotel
review: I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo Managing Director

title: Traditional and friendly
review: I found the hotel very good because of location, friendly staff, cleanliness and etc, etc. We found the balcony attached to our room very cozy.     My daughter forgot her smartphone in the room, which was found and give to us immediately.

title: classic comfort, chilly welcome
review: I thank you very much for your beautiful review and when  should you be back in Florence, please feel free to contact us. Best regards. Riccardo Ceseri Managing Director

title: Elegant, warm, location, location, location.
review: This hotel just made our visit to Florence so very convenient. We could practically walk down to most of the tourist places and did not even need a cab.Centrally located, nice rooms, clean bathrooms and great breakfast. Very convenient to reach the station and head out to Pisa.

title: Everything was great
review: A very nice home away from home. A kind of boutique hotel at walking distance from the Arno, Florence's city/cathedral/museums/churches/squares/markets center, minutes from the central train station. Sparkling clean bathroom--the maid works most conscientiously--and excellent breakfast for the health-conscious and the caloric-forgetful. Furnishings reminded of an elegant era, still fresh, with comfortable reading room. A real find.

title: fantastic hotel
review: I thank you very much for your beautiful review and when should you be back in Florence, please feel free to contact us. Beste regards.  Riccardo Ceseri Managing Director

title: wonderful location, friendly staff and fantastic ambiance.
review: Starting with the location within walking distance from the train station.  We walked everywhere.  We stayed in a room with a balcony overlooking the outdoor courtyard...very quiet.  Everything was clean and the bathroom was a generous size with a tub/shower.  Service was outstanding

title: Excellent Location
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Nice hotel but some of the staff?
review: Hotel is very easy to walk to from the train station.  Location is within walking distance to all sites and 3 blocks from the river.  Front Desk Staff very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast room was a little crowded.  Food was plentiful and good.  Wait staff slow and very inattentive.  I had a single room at front of the hotel.  As long as window was closed, the room was quiet enough.  Bed was like sleeping on a board and pillow was hard and flat.  Bathroom was a good size for a European hotel.  There was a small shower with a curtain, so it didn't seem as small as it was.  WiFi was free and worked very well. As a solo traveler, I felt very safe in the hotel and the area.

title: Very good choice
review: A very conveniently situated hotel some 300m from the railway station. It was unseasonably warm and humid. We entered into the air conditioned lobby. Only one key card per room but do not worry they have a master key card at reception. The rooms were adjacent but not adjoining. The rooms were hot and the air conditioning was not working. We went to ask for a/c at reception and we're told that it was not provided in October and then we were told to open a window. We did this in both rooms . The traffic noise in the room at the front was deafening.  I went to lie down. The room door opened and a gruff voice told me to put the key card in the slot next to the door. But  worse was to come. After an uncomfortably hot night we woke to find ourselves covered in mosquito bites. We went…

title: Close to train station
review: Dear Mr Williams, Reading your review I understand that the main cause  of your remarks was the warm temperature in your rooms due to a lack of air conditioning. By the way, I assure you that normally in Florence (not only in our Hotel) we turn off the air conditioning systems since September. Allow me to disagree with your statement, as the average temperature in Florence from 27th to 31st October (your stay) was 19°C. I might add that you were quite lucky to find such mild temperatures, which are rather unusual for Florence in October. Regarding your encounter with the Barman, his only concern was the decor of his working place, and clearly your laying on the sofa of the cocktail bar as if it were your own home, "was not nice”. However, I hope to see you as our guest in our Hotel and send you my best regards. Ceseri Riccardo Managing Director

title: Really great place to stay
review: This was the first time we traveled to Florence, although we have visited Italy before. It was our short honeymoon and this was communicated to the hotel, that although we made the reservataion via a third-party vendor was very eager to satisfy our needs. The location of the hotel was excellent, as it close very close to the historic center being at the same time very quite. It has been recently refurbished without, however losing its renaissance style. Even though they have made efforts to improve inner noise between rooms, plumbing, could not be totally restored and you could hear it, expecially at night. The breakfast needs imrpovement, as several things have already finished even 1.5 hr before the end of the breakfast times. Finally, it would be nice to have some more…

title: Our favorite choice in Florence

title: Great location for a few days stay !!
review: A little less than a year ago, we stayed at the Adler Cavalieri and loved its staff, accommodations and excellent location ... a short walk from the Santa Maria Novella (SMN) train station, intercity bus terminal and local buses.  SMN also is the area at which most tour buses (including the hop-on/hop-off bus) collect and discharge clients. I wrote a review for TripAdvisor last year entitled "We will return" and we have! Hotel prices were somewhat higher this year, mainly because we went in early September this year (still high season) rather than in mid-November last year. I made the reservation directly with the hotel and they offered a "returning guest discount" which was much appreciated.  The staff hasn't changed (right down to the smiling porter); breakfasts haven't…

title: Great 4 Star Hotel Near the Train Station!
review: I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards.  Ceseri Riccardo Managing Director

title: Great Location
review: As part of a recent vacation in Italy my wife and I stayed for three days at this boutique hotel.  It is located near the bus and train stations and provides a good daily base from which to see all the significant sights in Florence. You can safely walk from the hotel to all the sights in Florence...just take a street map.  The staff are friendly and it is not a busy spot kind of tucked away in a side street.  It can get a bit noisy at night with traffic but not a real concern.

title: More comfy than most and very convenient
review: July 15 - 18 2013, We travelled around Italy by train, so it was important for us to stay near the Florence train station Santa Maria Novella.  The Hotel Adler Cavalieri is about as close as you can get, less than 1 block from the platform.  Our travel agent recommended this hotel and it is a fine 4 star choice.  Firstly this is not a huge hotel with many rooms, but rather a more intimate experience with beautifully appointed rooms and spacious public areas.  The included breakfast is special, your choice of eating outside in a private inner courtyard or inside in an elegant lounge setting.  Our favorite coffee during our trip was here in the morning.  Florence is a walking city and we found it a convenient location to walk to the major sightseeing venues in about  15 – 30 min. …

title: No worth staying..
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Outdated but closest to the train station as you can get
review: Only good part of this hotel is ..it is very near from the station. Ambience is so scarey.. room size is too small..cutains..bed covers looklike not changed for years n years.. Breakfast is no much choice. Restaurent is cojusted.. i will nwver ver advice to opt for it.. For services there is nothing for them to give any kind of service.. hotel dont provide much ..

title: Nice hotel
review: Lovely "classical" design hotel with complete set of amenities including slippers (Rare to find in Europe!) and suggestion cards. This hotel is right around a corner from the train station. There are tour offices near by for last minute tours. We were able to book a Sienna day trip upon arrival through Agenza Viaggi's tour office beside the SITA bus station. The hotel receptionist wanted to charge more than double for a similar tour. I thought the hotel was all good, seeing as how much they spent on amenities and the breakfast spread, but I woke up with bed bugs bites all over my back. This took a week or more to subside.  Upon checkout, the graveyard shift receptionist R was really confused and sleepy at 5 am and could not handle the payment change counting correctly. While we…

title: Great hotel
review: Stayed in August 2013 with family and friends.  The location of the hotel was fantastic and just a 2 min walk from Firenze train station and all the sights.  The rooms were comfortable (expected more, to be honest) but clean with a spacious bathroom.  Most of the staff were friendly enough but the breakfast was disappointing.  The range was poor and when we arrived half way through breakfast (on our last day), we found that almost everything was gone and nobody was re-filling.

title: One of my favourite hotels
review: Very nice hotel, traditional décor, clean. The location was excellent, close to the train station, the sights, restaurants, pharmacy, etc. The breakfast was excellent too. Most of the reception staff was friendly and nice, spoke very good English. We had a wonderful room, a good size with French doors that opened up onto a balcony.

title: Very nice hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Very nice hotel
review: Very nice hotel, nicely located, good infrastructure, spacious room. Breakfast could be a little bit better, also the service of staff.  We requested late check out for two rooms as our train leaves at 13;30 and we want to stay in the hotel until 1pm, the staff was not very happy about this request and finally accept to have only 1 room late check out to 1pm

title: Nice and near the old town
review: This hotel was excellent. Centrally located, everything was just a short walk away. The front desk staff were extremely nice and very easy to deal with. The hotel is beautiful inside, including the rooms. The rooms were very clean. We stayed here 2 nights and enjoyed our stay.  Overall, there were a few minor issues we had with our room, but nothing that impacted our stay too much. We would definitely recommend the adler cavlieri to those visiting Florence.

title: Great hotel!
review: This hotel was formerly a convent and I reckon the nice little patio on the shade,  with high trees where 7 tables with chairs stand for breakfast time,  and the only noise you hear is birds singing every morning , may be a reminder of those days .  At breakfast time , taste a delicious home-made pie made with almonds . It is so good that I ordered 2 to bring them home. So if you like it as much as me , feel free to get one at least when you leave. I stayed 8 nights and Sofia ,Leonard and Mattia  , the waiters who served me at breakfast , made the very beginning of the day a perfect and unstressed start for a week filled up with lots of tours and high temperatures . The decoration  is English-like with panelled walls and leather sofas next to a fireplace in the sitting room ,…

title: Comfortable room in good location
review: Great breakfast, nice big and clean rooms, great service, 2 blocks away from Santa Maria Novella train station (walking distance even when carrying luggage). Only 10 min walk to city center and main attractions. It was a pleasant stay!

title: Good value for money
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. title: Poor quality of room#6
review: My wife have stayed at this hotel together with 2 friends a couple of years ago, and we chose this hotel based on her experiences.   Hotel looks a bit old fashioned, but we had a well sized room with a good bathroom. Hotel breakfast included in rate, and this was ok.   Hotel is situated very close to bus and railway station, and it is a 10-15 min walk to the Duomo. The hotel has very good staff in all functions. Very service minded, polite, and speaking english well.   We had a quiet room against the backyard.  We will use this hotel again!

title: close and pleasant
review: I thank you and I have appreciated very much your review. Best regards.  Riccardo Ceseri

title: Wonderful experience!
review: I stayed at the hotel on 3rd and 4th of June 2013. I paid Euro 396 for 2 nights. The room#6 was in the corner of a dark/damp garden smelling of sewage and when opening the door mosquitoes would get into the room. The bath towels were old and discoloured. The blankets were small (for single bed) were old old and dirty-looking. The room also smelled stale cigarettes, even my booking was confirmed as Non-smoking. The TV was also tiny. The included breakfastfood was terrible, cold, old bread. We were very depressed staying in such a place. The only positive note was their staff, very friendly and helpful. (B PHIN - NSW- Australia)

title: Location, location and a very pleasing accommodation.
review: I'm really very sorry because my main objective  is the satisfaction of our guests, but  I don't want to replicate to a subjective judgement on our room, because I consider beautifuil and very original the room numer 006 equipped with white marble floors, ceiling with wood beams and painted walls. We assure you that we have taken note of your suggestions and we will do everything possible to improve. Best regards. Ceseri Riccardo

title: PERFECT SERVICE , A REAL 4 STARS HOTEL
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Very central location
review: When you enter, a staff member in uniform will be glad to accompany you and show your room. Particularly he will show you how to correctly use your magnetic badge. The single room 115 was charming, with old furniture in perfect stand. Nice and charming balcony. The staff is very attentive and full of attention towards the customer. Excellent and rich breakfast. Real value for our money.

title: Comfortable, clean and convenient.
review: I thank you very much for your feedback and I hope to have you again as our guest in our hotel. Best regards.  Ceseri Riccardo

title: Great Breakfast
review: As we were only staying in Florence for one night we wanted a hotel that was central to the sights. This hotel fitted the bill as it is easy to walk from the train station and as we went on to Siena on the bus it was also around the corner from the SITA bus station.  The hotel is a little dated but still charming and very clean. Our room was quiet as it was on the inside of the Hotel overlooking a court yard and the room was spacious with a great shower and a safety deposit box. Also has a lift.  The breakfast was very good. Nice pastries, hot food and fruit. We like strong coffee so asked for a double expresso which was not available on the buffet and they made it promptly with a smile.  They stored our bags for us securely and made a sitting room and toilet available for us…

title: Will definitely return
review: I wanted accommodation close to the sights yet convenient for the station and the Adler fitted the bill perfectly. My single room was comfortable and quiet with a lovely bathroom which helped to soak away the aches and pains after a long days walking. The staff are friendly and helpful, and breakfast varied, plentiful and coeliac friendly. I knew before I booked that the hotel decor is a little 'gentlemans club', rather than Italian chic but that didn't detract from my stay.

title: Unique hotel that was once a monastery.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Quiet stay in small room
review: This hotel has kept its old world feel. It has  panel wood walls and leather chairs in the sitting room downstairs and the rooms are located down hallways and stairways that make you feel as though you have been transported back in time. Our room was well set out, spacious enough and cosy.

title: Great room, breakfast and staff
review: The nice hotel near train station and Conference Center with quiet small rooms for single stay, perfect fire place in 1 st floor, SPA. The front desk staff was kind, but breakfast staff seemed slow and not attentive as quest are forced to wait for coffee and food.

title: Excellent hotel option in Florence close to train station
review: all that you need is in this hotel. They have safety deposit box, well equipped bathroom and good security for the rooms. Breakfast is good and staff are friendly. the only downside is the neighbourhood is a little shady with shady character. near the SITA bus station for those who want to go to THE MALL outlet. overall is good.

title: Grand hotel that is close to Train Station
review: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during Christmas 2012. The location was excellent, less than 5 minutes walk from the train station and 10-12 minutes leisurely walk to the Duomo. Overall this was an excellent hotel with friendly staff, all amenities you expect. Included breakfast was excellent. As others have noted, the hotel has lot of character, although can appear slightly dated, and room was smaller than we anticipated. Wi-fi worked well. Definitely recommend.

title: Nice Comfortable Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. title: Perfect if you are into character
review: Smaller rooms with a warm comfortable feel, everything was comfortable and the staff was helpful. Within walking distance of David and City center. Only stayed here one night, but I would stay again. Was a quiet area without any troubles.

title: Fabulous hotel
review: This hotel has lots of character.  It is old but pretty well maintained.  I stayed in Room 6, which is a wonderful little bungalow-like room apart from the other rooms in the hotel.  Although it smelled a little musty, one I aired it out, it was just fine.   The room was a very good size as was the bathroom.  The only complaint here seems to be a trend in Italy... the showers do not drain!  There also is no alarm clock in the room and you are not allowed to use an iron in the room either. Some of the other rooms opened up to a neat little courtyard that was a nice place to have breakfast or drinks.  The breakfast food options were plenty also.  Lots of variety that certainly appeased our group of Americans. The staff was friendly and courteous and were helpful when recommending…

title: Great hotel
review: We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights in July , and found it to be the most pleasant stay of our whole holiday. Spacious bedroom with bath and shower and courtyard , excellent aircom .  The buffet breakfast was fantastic with a good variety of food and beverage .  The hotel has a comfortable lounge area with free international  papers wifi ideal for both business and holiday travellers  .. very central to the railway station and all the sites .  We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Florence , infact our friend works for Thomas Cook and we are told they offer this hotel to their clients   would give it a five star rating  and the staff are wonderful

title: lovely  hotel  in  great  City
review: The hotel is simply great. Very clean, friendly staff, very nice and cosy interior, own balcony/terrace, and good bed standard. Also a great breakfast buffe also able to dine outside. Simply a very good value for money hotel. We stayed at 4 different 4 star hotels in Florence and this was by far the best!!!

title: Filthy room, fruit flies for breakfast
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Hotel attached to fume-filled bus depot in Stazione area
review: The location is convenient -- being right next to the train station. But then again, our stay there was so awful that the convenience of the hotel location was overshadowed by everything else about it that really matters during one's stay at an hotel (mainly filthiness of the room and poor breakfast).   The room in which we stayed was so gross -- a stench came out of the bathroom, like we were staying in the middle of a sewer!! It was an awful experience. Shame on a filthy place that calls itself a four-star hotel and yet keeps guests -- on vacation!!! -- in a filthy, disgusting room.  The breakfast was so poor, with fruit flies infesting the fruit bowls.

title: Booked a different hotel, stayed here instead
review: Dear Mr Nidal, it is impossible to replicate a judgment that does not tell the entire experience, because you  stayed 6 nights and you do not write that the room was changed, I invite all tripadvisor members visiting room 302 to give their opinion of this room. Best regards.  Riccardo Ceseri Managing Director - Hotel Adler Cavalieri

title: Points on location, room, hygiene, breakfast, hospitality and quiteness
review: Hotel Area: Stazione / Train Station  - Very close to train station - Hotel building attached to the bus depot; poor air quality - Smoggy, polluted, busy area  - Found it just a bit too far a walk to main attractions (centre historique) on a searingly hot summer day  - Would recommend a hotel closer to centre if you are elderly, have kids, etc.  - Tourist Info office across the street from front entrance of train station  - Carpeted rooms except for those on ground floor - Trams and local bus stops closeby (but nowhere was a transit map to be found in the city)     I went to Italy in June/July 2012. And am just getting to writing reviews intermittently when I can find time.   Pollution and Air Quality For those sensitive to smells and smog/pollution, I would advise to stay away…

title: Both charming and efficient
review: Thank you for sending us your opinion, but you've probably inserted in the wrong section of the website Tripadvisor.com, because I calculated that 81% of your review (the calculation is correct) says:  air quality in the neighborhood of Santa Maria Novella, traffic, Florence card, the people of Florence. We are delighted with the suggestions of our customers, but certain problems such as traffic, Florence card, air quality, florentiners are not our responsibility and we haven’t any solutions, so your advices may, however, be useful for other people in the Florence Tourism section or in Travel Forum section.  Regards. Riccardo Ceseri - Managing Director

title: Nice hotel, great location and very helpful staff
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Helpful to the Max!
review: We stayed in this hotel during our trip to Italy. This is one of the best hotels we had in our trip. The staff was very helpful. When we reached there, we were told that our reservation did not reach them even though I booked through one the major travel sites. When I showed the confirmation email, they did everything they can to accommodate us. I think they have even upgraded our room. We booked a triple room, our room had 1 bed room with double bed and two other rooms with single bed in each, had two TVs and the bathroom was very clean and nice.The hotel is also in a great location, just a few minutes walk from the railway station. The staff was also very helpful in providing any information, tickets, etc for city tour. Breakfast was plenty. The only con was the carpet on the…

title: Quaint, historical and cozy
review: Every member of the staff went out of their way to answer every question we had and to make our stay comfortable and memorable.  The train station is just a block away so the Adler is in a great location if you want to move on from Florence.  I echo the other comments...breakfast was plentiful and good, the rooms were comfortable with great a/c and a deep tub.  The hotel is quiet, but when you step out you are right in the bustle of Florence.  A gem of a hotel.

title: Classes Gem
review: This was our first stop during our 10 day cycling trip of Tuscany.  The rooms, although small by US standards, were comfortable, quiet and pleasingly furnished. The breakfasts were standard fare continental style, but meals cooked to order were available from the servers.  Free fast internet access was available all over the hotel property.  I was impressed with the servers from the attached dining room who said- "our food is frozen, go into Florence for a fresh meal!". Which I did. Great advice.

title: Italian at heart!
review: Loved the Adler. We were there before begining our guided bike tour inTuscany. The hotel exceeded our expectations. We had a a quiet Courtyard room.  Bed and a/c were perfect. Excellent breakfast and attentive staff. Quiet street with nearby restaurants frequented by locals.

title: Walking distance to everything and a nice ambience
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Beautiful old convent
review: Well run hotel, the staff were present in a friendly way. The rooms were very clean and had a pleasant ambience. Lots of interesting nooks and corners where you could hang out. The court yard were they served a good breakfast was wonderful to sit in. And there is also a bar area with a small fountain. You can walk to all the major sights. The hotel is very close to the station, just a few minutes walk.

title: My Favourite Hotel in Florence
review: The hotel Adler Cavalieri in Florence is so beautiful, the ornate ceilings and wooden decor (especially in the rooms) make it even more special.   It was interesting to know that it was an old convent that had been converted into a hotel. Really friendly staff, great breakfast and the location was excellent. Rooms were very clean and comfortable and spacious.

title: Good location, okay hotel
review: Have just returned from a small garden tour to Tuscany and Lake Como.  This is my second stay at the Adler Cavalieri in Florence and I have to say, this is my favorite hotel in Florence.  I have stayed in many hotels in Florence over the years with groups and individually, and the Adler is by far the best.  The location is perfect for both pleasure and business, the staff are excellent, the breakfast great and the rooms perfectly appointed.  The hotel is small enough, not to be classified as a group hotel, yet can accommodate a group with ease without interupting business and independent guests.  Everyone is treated so well.  Nothing is too much trouble. Andrea, Lisa and Franco could not have been more helpful.  The bar at the top of the hotel is a great way to relax after a…

title: Clean, convenient location, friendly staff
review: We stayed here recently for 3 nights while visiting Florence.  While the location is fantastic and the room was quite spacious, the bed was pretty bad.  The pillows were very hard as was the bed.  The sheets were also very rough - not soft at all....   The room met our needs, but I would likely look for another option if I was to go back.   The staff was wonderful, very friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was good as well.  Overall, if you are looking for location and service, this is a lovely place if you don't mind a rock hard bed and pillows.

title: Hotel elegante, servizio impeccabile, posizione perfetta
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Lovely hotel in the heart of Florence
review: I was here for work 3 nights... perfect position, place well kept and with a style. Furnished with good taste with all sort of confort. In the basement has a lovely SPA area where you can find some peace from the noise of the city. Small but perfect space for a gym and a perfect bar in a little patio on the first floor and you will forget to be in the centre of Florence. The staff is just very helpful, friendly and discreet. Breakfast is excellent and just what you like to get in the morning. Exccelent for a romantinc week end or to take your family ...

title: great location and breakfast in florence
review: I had a great  visit at the Adler May 10-13, staying in a spacious single room facing the street. Although it was warm in the room and the windows didn't open, it wasn't oppressive and I still slept well. The bathroom was spacious and very well -stocked with toiletries. The  flat panel TV seemed new. The draperies and linens were lovely -- fantastic sheets with the crest of Florence on them! The ceiling paintings were very Florentine, a nice touch. The room and bath were spotless.  It was odd not to be able to serve yourself coffee in the breakfast room, however, and even when the waiter noticed me sitting at a table and asked me my room number, he would just speed off without inquiring if I wanted coffee!! But the breakfast selection was excellent, with the great croissants and…

title: Free wifi
review: Great spot to stay that is close to historic center, SMN train station, and bus station.  Excellent, friendly, professional staff.  Superb breakfast was included.  Room was not large, nor was the bathroom, but all was clean and fresh.  I would stay here again and recommend to friends.  Overall, very good value due to location, staff, and breakfast.

title: Was Very Happy!
review: A taxi from the airport cost ca 20 Euro + 1 Euro/suitcase. The hotel is situated just back-a-yard- to the bus and train station. Florence is a relatively small city with walking distance to most attractions.   Appreciate very much free wifi, nice breakfast buffet and overall friendly atmosphere. The room was sheer warm, stale air at +25C degrees, which felt unbearable. Hotel pointed though at some Italian regulation that AC was not permitted until end of March. Beware! Hotel in need of general refreshing, see e.g. foto attached of wall in room in need of paint to cross out stains.  7-11 equivalence just next to the hotel where you can pick up mineral water at fair price (compared to mini bar).

title: No complains
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Good location, clean hotel
review: Well located, very friendly and helpful personnel, great breakfast. Walking distance from train station and city center. There are rooms looking to an inner yard that feels and looks like Tuscany. If you escape the lousy weather I got, these can be very romantic rooms. Though somewhat weirdly located, it pays off every time one goes in or out the room. Be aware that reservations to galleries and other sites can be made at the sites for 3 euros less than charged at the hotel.

title: Convenient, clean
review: We stayed 4 nights in april in Adler Hotel. Very close to train station and Florence center(10 min to Dome, 5 min to San Lorenzo, 10 min to Ufizzi). Breakfast is quite good for usual italian hotels, if they add some fresh vegetables and local products it will be perfect. Very clean and quiet rooms. The biggest problem was the heating system who didn't worked well. We were charged for parking 22 eur/day (not big difference from 20 in a city parking) for a van. Overall a nice experience. I will recomand it for friends.

title: Back in the Medici era....
review: We stayed two nights at the Adler Cavalieri in April 2012.  We arrived in Florence from Venice by train and found the hotel just around the corner from the train station.  The hotel was clean and spacious.  We had a triple room that had a large king size bed and a single which worked perfectly for us.  The room was very clean and the bathroom modern.  We needed to use a computer and the desk staff allowed us to use a hotel owned laptop.  Lisa, a clerk at the front desk, was extremely helpful.  When a problem with our advanced tickets to the Accademie occurred, she got on the phone and solved the issue for us.  Very helpful!  The hotel sits on a rather dingy but safe street.  We never felt unsafe.  It is in walking distance to most Florence attractions.  We will stay here again. …

title: Conveniently located
review: We stayed for 3 nights in this outdated Hotel. Doesn't look like a Hotel leave alone a 4 star from outside nor inside. The only plus point of this place is the breakfast and the location ( close to the railway station) which did not help us much as we had driven down. The parking charges are outrageous.. 32 euros per night... We saw the dated sign outside when we were looking for the Hotel. We didn't know where the entrance was until we stood in front of the glass door which then slid open. We were hoping then atleast the interior of the Hotel would pep us up.. Alas.. That was not to be... The receptionist was courteous but did not offer help with places to go to.. Just gave us a map and told us to figure it out. We asked for help with the bags as our car was outside. The…

title: Nice hotel in Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. title: professional and friendly
review: Stayed overnight in Florence at Adler Cavalieri. We found the room to be a bit dated, but certainly clean and comfortable. We had one of the rooms on the top level of the hotel with a balcony overlooking the "kinda" courtyard. This was much preferred compared to your normal window that opens a few inches. Unlike some of the photos on TripAdvisor showing old tube style TVs and someone complaining about no WIFI, we were pleasantly surprised that we there was a flat panel, and WIFI (at least in our room) was fast enough for Skype.  In terms of location, only a few blocks from the train station which was great. Just a note though that Google puts the location of this hotel on the wrong block, so we had to ask for directions and trek back a few blocks before finding the hotel.…

title: Good , but needs renovation
review: we had a wonderful stay in Florence in this excellent hotel. There is not a single inconvenience/problem and we are more than happy with service provided. Not only that we will recommend it to our friends, but we will certainly choose it again  for our stay in Florence next time.   Very professional and friendly service.  Lazic family, Serbia

title: Good for overnight stay - close to railway station
review: This is very well located-next to the railway station. The rooms are quite big and the amenities provided are also good enough. Everything about the hotel seemed "average"- but its nt something that you can rave about. The corridors were musty, a bit damp. The breakfast fare was adequate-but then, service was pathetic...there was hardly any replenishment of the sausages,scrambled eggs or fruits-you need to go and remind them (which is always not very pleasant). But, given its location-you can walk from the train station to the hotel with your luggage. And then walk around all the sights of Florence.

title: Do yourself a favor
review: We stayed here for two nights and chose the hotel for its location near to the Santa Maria Novella train station.  Not only were we arriving and leaving by train, we also took a day tour that left from the train station, so the location was perfect for that purpose.  Other than that, there was not much that set the hotel apart.  The room was small but comfortable, though the decor was not what we were used to.  It depends on what you like, I guess, but for us, the furnishing (carpets, wall, upholstery etc) was a bit heavy.  Our room was on the first floor and we were fortunate to be able to access the free wi-fi from our room.    From the hotel, we could walk to all the major attractions in Florence.  There were a few mini-marts close to the hotel - they stocked mainly alcohol…

title: Great hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great stay in Florence
review: We stayed here for three nights in a twin room. The room was great, very quiet and the bathroom was excellent. The room was very comfortable.     There wasn't wifi in the rooms but you could get it in the public areas so we took our ipads to the bar at night and the bartender who was there every night was fantastic! Very, very friendly. And there were free snacks in the bar every night.      The breakfast was also very good and the waiters there were friendly too.      The location was good we could walk to everything in Florence.      All the staff were very friendly and the rooms were more then comfortable.

title: Amazing way to spend our birthday!
review: Very close to the metro, this beautiful hotel in downtown Florence is everything it is cut out to be. Great value for the money. The rooms were very comfortable and quite elegant. The hotel staff were very helpful. Went out of their way to arrange transportation for our group of 6 to Rome. Free continental breakfast in the morning was incredible. A real variery of different dishes. Highly recommend the Hotel Adler Cavalieri

title: Good value, good for short stay
review: We stayed 2 nights and loved the Adler Cavalieri.  It is conveniently located near the train station.  Room is clean and well appointed although very dark with all the wood.  We loved the balcony overlooking the courtyard and the minute we checked in my husband made himself a cafe and sat plotting our course for the day.  The staff was extremely lovely and you must go to the upstairs lounge to visit Bernardo.  He makes the best martini's and a real professional barman.  They had quite a nice little spread at cocktail hour and the room was quite comfortable.   Breakfast was well done.   Would absolutely stay here again.

title: Excellent One Night Stay at the Adler
review: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in August and I cannot say anything bad about it apart from the fact that I thought the furniture was a bit old and the sheets didn't smell fresh. Double glazed windows and very dark curtains really give you a good night sleep which was a big plus in central Florence. The hotel is centrally located, it's very close to the main train station and the bus station if you're interested in travelling around Tuscany. Also there is a laundrette two steps away, which we found very useful, half-way our stay. Unfortunately no balconies in any rooms, we were told. Breakfast was OK, could be better. All in all, this hotel is ideal for a short stay.

title: Really liked hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Staff saved it!
review: Really nice hotel & near to all the main attractions. If you plan to use train & bus station the place is ideal. My only issue was that we got 2 single beds but we did not ask to change room so just pushed them together. Breakfast good & they serve all coffee types.

title: Good location, clean, with reasonable prices and amenities
review: Sept. 5-11, 2011. The hotel was clean, some small areas around the room were broken, but the big problem with our room was the smell! Had a handicapped friendly room (dont know why) and the shower area was just a curtain wrapped around the shower head and the tiled floor with a drain. No pan etc. Every morning the horrid smell coming up from the drain in that area was really putrid. Each evening placed a wet towel over the drain until the morning when we could put the shower on and try and dissipate the smell. The cleanliness of the tile on the shower floor was also very much in question. Hotel also in an area that at night when either walking back from the core area or trying to find a place to have a drink around there, was sketchy. A number of shady people drinkning in door…

title: Excellent! Will definitely be back!
review: We stayed 3 nights here and were surprised at the quality of the hotel. Overall it was quite clean, friendly staff, good location, and quiet. Breakfast was included, but left a bit to be desired. Surprisingly enough, there was a gym in the building. A first for all the places we've stayed in Italy. If we venture to Florence again, we would consider staying here again.

title: Fantastic Hotel in a Great Location...
review: My 2 girlfriends and I stayed in a triple room on the 3rd floor. The room was clean and cosy and the bathroom was modern and spotless. The mattress was firm and comfortable. We were also impressed with the excellent service of the staff from the reception, porter and F&B, especially Franco from reception who was extremely warm, helpful and sincere. Breakfast was a good selection of continental and american - crossiants, cereals, eggs, sausages etc. Most importantly, we felt safe and the location was most convenient - just 5min away from SMN Station. Highly recommended!

title: wonderful surprise
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Unsafe - Hotel allows non-guests to wonder the grounds - I was robbed
review: We were with a tour group so we really didn't pick this hotel. We were supposed to go to another hotel but for some reason we were booked at this hotel instead. From the moment we arrived (late at night since we were coming from Assisi) we wanted for nothing. The hotel was very very nice and the room was roomy enough. We were on the main floor so we didn't have to wait for elevators which I appreciated. we have our own private terrace overlooking a courtyard. The room was spotless and the amenities were what you would have expected from a 4 star hotel. I especially liked that there was a safe in the room. Bathroom was clean and bright and had a very nice tub and shower. Breakfast was plentiful and you were served coffee by a waiter at your table. Since we were on a tour the bus…

title: Beautiful and charming!
review: While the hotel is beautiful and the staff exceptional - nonguests are allowed to wander the hotel grounds, my purse was stolen in the restaurant while I refilled my coffee.  Other hotels I stayed at in Italy allowed only registered guests past reception.  The hotel installed a key system so that only guests paying extra could use sauna but did not do the same to ensure guest safety in the rest of the hotel.

title: We walked to all attractions - from David to Duomo to the river
review: We stayed at this hotel in Florence for two nights in early June. I was a little uneasy about staying so close to the train station but it was wonderful with no worries. The rooms were beautifully appointed with lovely linens, a spotlessly, modern bathroom that had oodles of soft towels. Each room provided slippers, biscotti, a safe and a bar fridge for personal use. The lobby , common areas, and breakfast room is beautifully decorated with dark  wood and appropriate draperies. The self-serve breakfast was excellent with table service to handle any of your needs. The front desk staff were friendly and very accommodating. After leaving the train station we were at the hotel in less than 5 minutes. We walked to all of the attractions. We were especially close to the market which…

title: Could there be any better?
review: Size of room: tight fit for 3 persons, but manageable.  Very clean and well maintained.  The lift stopped at the same level as our room.  We asked for and got a quiet room.  Our unit has a French door that opens up to a roof top 'garden', with our private corner which has table and chairs.  We had our dinner there while the sun set; also in the quiet.  Nice.  Location of the hotel is great: it's outside of the driving zone; so we could drive our car and deposit our luggage.  It's far enough from the maddening crowd, and near enough to walk 'everywhere'.  David in Accademia and Uffizi are about 15-minute walk away.  Duomo is 8 minutes away.  Within 3 minute walk from the hotel are: cheap food like Turkish kebabs; small mini marts; internet cafe; laundry; train station, etc. …

title: Definitely one to book
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Nice hotel...
review: This refined hotel is conveniently located one street back from the Railway/Bus Station.  The rooms are tastefully decorated and very comfortable.  Breakfast  was really good. The staff were professional and very helpful.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location, very good service, value for money.
review: Nice city hotel. Nice rooms, very traditional which is what we were looking for.  This hotel is situated just around the corner from the bus and train station so in a busy area with lots of traffic and noise.  The staff were helpful and obliging.  We stayed B&B but the breakfast was not to good but this is my personal opinion. Short walk to all the sights.

title: Lovely small hotel
review: We stayed at the Adler Cavalieri for 2 nights late in May 2011. Very unsupposing from the front, but old style nice inside.  It is located just around the corner from the railway station and central to buses and the hop-on hop-off bus services. The rooms are comfortable and clean and resonably spacious. It turned out to be an excellent base for our couple of days of sightseeing.  Florence has so much to offer and the buses took us all over the place. The concierge at the hotel was most helpful with the location of out-of-the-way places and any other matter we wanted to raise.  The hotel is easily a 3.5 star hotel. Breakfast was very good and there was even an outside breakfast area in a courtyard, which added a nice touch. This place is certainly to be recommended if you are…

title: Amazing, amazing hotel at a great value!
review: I took a few days in Florence after a business trip in Rome.  This hotel is within walking distance from the train station, and is close to everything (I guess that's par for the course in Florence).  My single room was small but lovely, with a little terrace overlooking the garden patio.  Internet was included as well as a very nice buffet breakfast.  The room and bathroom were very clean and well-maintained -- small, but quite liveable and comfortable.  In-room safe, non-smoking, quiet, and good hair dryer.

title: An elegant and very comfortable hotel....
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: wonderful stay, clean, spacious rooms, affordable
review: This was a very comfortable and elegant hotel once inside- located near S. Maria Nouvella. From the outside the street looked very ordinary and the hotel was a delight when one stepped inside. It is a distance from other key sites but this did not prove a problem for us on this occasion. We found the room very comfortable; clean, neat and with a beautiful balcony with view over a courtyard. The breakfast was very good, and we found the staff helpful with pre-booking our entrance to museums - which is a must and saved queuing which most other people seemed to do. We spent 5 nights here. Given we were away for 2 months in Italy - we were looking for comfotable hotels but we were somewhat keen for good value at the same time. This hotel was very good - and would make a good choice.…

title: Adler Cavalieri is convenient to train station with compfortable & quiet rooms
review: Absolutely loved this hotel. The room we got was twice the size as our other hotels in Italy. Nice big and comfortable bed. Helpful staff. They had reserved a time slot for us to go see David. Great location by the train station.  It was just great. Would highly recommend!

title: Perfect for exploration of Firenzr
review: My husband, 18 year old son had a great stay at Adler Cavalieri.  Our triple room was very nice with a large bathroom. Conveniently located a couple of blocks from main train station. The staff was very helpful and we enjoyed a delicious and generous breakfast buffet.  Loved our stay in Firenze or Florence!

title: Great stay
review: This hotel has a very good standard in all the aspects we learned about it for our seven day stay.   It is well situated for walking to all the attractions in Firenze.  The beds are pleasantly hard.  The breakfast buffet is fine, though the English breakfast didn't look too appealing, but it tasted all-right.

title: A good reasonable hotel in Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great location but let down by the staff
review: This is a good hotel with good service in a convenient location near the Florence SMN station (5 minutes walk). Most of the attractions are within 20-30 mins walking distance. The rooms are spacious and welcoming. The breakfast spread is very good compared to European standards. Most of the staff members are helpful (there are exceptions in every hotel).   However, please be aware that the hotel does not switch on its AC in April (even though it was very hot). For this reason we had to open the room windows and te room became noisy.  Will definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent - location, look & feel, services
review: We were booked in to the Adler Cavalieri as we had researched various hotels in Florence for sometime and this hotel consistently came out with great reviews. On arrival with a significant amount of luggage we were greeted by the helpful door staff who took our luggage up to the room. The reception staff seemed uninterested and bored and did not strike up any conversation even although we were are both fluent Italian speakers. On arrival in the room I felt it was very dated in terms of the decor and the rooms were very small. We had a room facing the inside of the hotel so the only views from the window were right into other guests rooms - not ideal but this can't be helped. The bathroom was small also and several fittings on the walls were loose, there was also a light bulb not…

title: Low cost , high comfort
review: We were there with our 3-years old son for a few days to see & experience Florence and Tuscany -and the hotel served that purpose very well, exceeding actually our expectations (we knew it would be good but the actual location, architecture and local scenery- streets, shops, etc- were better than we thought they would be).   The room was big (for a central location) and also we appreciated a lot the presence of a nice saloon /library -where you could read a book in the quiet and classical atmosphere of the place;   Also- the location is perfect to start exploring both Florence (it is in central area, within walking distance of everything) and also other Tuscany locations (train station is 3 minutes from the hotel, also multiple rent-a-car locations are near).  Hotel staff- very…

title: Good hotel but expensive and watch the tip expectations !
review: The hotel is a five minute walk with luggage from the station. Quickly if you are not travelling with your 60 yr old mother and 10 year old child. Like most Cities the surrounding areas close to the train station are  a little bit more tattier than the centres. The hotel is not situated on the prettiest of roads, (the heart does miss a beat when you arrive knowing you are responsible for the booking ,its not easy keeping mother happy when she is use to five star. ) Once inside the welcome is warm and the staff are unfailingly  helpful. We stayed in a triple room which was spacious and very clean fresh bedding every day was supplied. The hotel may be on a busy room but it was quiet we never heard any noise. Do not be put off by the location of the hotel you are within walking…

title: Absolutely Wonderful
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. title: Nice hotel
review: I got bumped from another hotel that was overbooked and relocated to the Adler. So happy I was because the Adler was fabulous.  Beautiful old-world charm combined with modern baths and well-appointed rooms. Amazing breakfast was included in price and the wine bar on the second floor with indoor and outdoor seating was beautiful and romantic.  Staff made a great restaurant recommendation and were very nice.  For the price (about $175?) I've got to give it a 10 out of 10. Go, you'll love it!

title: I’d recommend  it to anyone
review: Pretty nice hotel, everything was compact about this hotel, I would say the only complaint about it is the one waiter in the mornings. It took forever to get a drink and the buffet was always out of some items. The room was nice and they had free internet access, the only hotel in Italy during our trip that had free internet access. All areas of the hotel are decorated nice.

title: Clean and decent hotel with friendly staff
review: Hotel Adler Cavalieri in Florence has a number of benefits, the first of which is its location. You won’t need a car to get to major landmarks, as Piazza del Duomo or Ponte Vecchio  are about 12-15 minutes’ walk. You also save the taxi fare to get to the railway station because it’s nearby. Don’t think it might noisy (not in the least!) as the hotel is situated in quiet Via della Scala 2 blocks from the station. We enjoyed a lavish breakfast in a cosy dining hall and we absolutely loved the  wellness center with a sauna and a Turkish bath. They provide a selection of aroma oils, this is what you need after a walking tour! And it’s cheap: only € 12.00 per person for one hour. The cocktail bar in a roof garden is lovely: gold fish, a fountain and a really plentiful free buffet to…

title: A Surprisingly Perfect Stay
review: A convenient hotel near to the train station and easy access to good food.  Staff are friendly, patient and helpful.

title: Wonderful Hotel, Great location and service, would stay again!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Close to the train and the sights
review: The hotel itself is adorable.  The breakfast room is quaint and pretty, with an option to eat inside or in a courtyard.  There is a bar upstairs, which is also lovely.  The location is perfect.  It is a 3-minute walk to the train station, which we did with luggage and no problems.  This is also convenient for trips outside of Florence (Pisa, Lucca, etc.).  Florence is a very walkable city.  This hotel was anywhere from 5 to 20 minutes (walking) from any site.  The city is flat and easy to walk, so the 20-minutes actually felt less.  We were even able to return to the hotel between site-seeing and dinner, because it was so close.  The service was great!  All of the reception staff were extremely helpful and gracious.  Ask them for dinner suggestions to get away from some touristy…

title: Truly a gem, loved this hotel!!!
review: Great location about 5 minutes from the train station. Walking distance to the Duomo and surrounding sights was about 15 minutes.  Rooms were nice (and a nice size). Go to the top floor bar for a cocktail and nice nibbles. Would recommend, and they are dog friendly.

title: Very good
review: The hotel was close to the train station, but there was no effects of it.  We walked everywhere from the hotel with no problem getting to any reservation on time.  The hotel was spotless and we were treated with excellent service.  The hotel layout was fantastic and with a little exploration, we found hidden gems throughout.  The breakfast was good and the bar (although we found this our last night) was romantic and very warm and inviting.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Much better than expected
review: A classic and nice room, though there single rooms are very very small. The complimentary internet (plus a laptop for guests you can ask from the reception) is a nice plus. Location is very convenient if using the train station, and an easy waling distance from Florence's beautiful spots. Breakfast is quite good (though waiters need to constantly be reminded to bring more of finished dishes). The reception staff is pretty friendly. Altogether, a very recommended hotel. I went there more than once, and I'll keep going there.

title: great hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella.
