title: A Gem of a Choice
review: i lover the perfect location of this hotel.  Good breakfast, yumi crossaints and coffe the rooms are very clean i loved

title: Excellent accomodation
review: We fell into a great discount.  We were delighted.  The staff was a bit odd about the spa usage, but the spa itself is A+, as the rest of the hotel. Breakfast is A+.  GREAT beds.  Clean. Staffed very well-trained.  A true respite from the heat and crowds of Florence.

title: Excellent stay
review: Hotel Adler Cavalieri is conveniently located at just 3 minutes walk from Santa Maria Novella train station in Florence. It is also at walkable distance from most attractions in Florence. It is located on a not-so-busy street, so it is very quiet.   Pluses: Location, friendly staff, continental breakfast that you can actually enjoy and free internet connection, which is a luxury in Europe. The room (#105) was very clean with its own courtyard. The room service was excellent.  Minuses: There is a liquor store nearby, so the crowd sometimes maybe very noisy. We never felt unsafe, but it was more of a nuisense.

title: One cannot go wrong in chosing this establishment!
review: As a young couple on our honeymoon, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves at this hotel. The rooms were clean (slightly old fashioned but that didnt bother us at all). The toliet was HUGE and clean. The tv channels were mostly in Italian but still enjoyable. The bed was good. We had our own little terrace with chairs and a table.  The service was great and the receptionist was really friendly. We actually had quite a laugh with him. The breakfast was fantastic..quite a spread of hot and cold food.  They have coffee/tea and biscuits at night as well.The location was great...hardly a 10 min walk to all the great restaurants and shops. There are also a couple of shops close by to buy water or snacks from at night.  Overall we had a fantastic experience in the budget that we had ....No…

title: An excellent place with a couple of drawbacks
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: "good location, just ok"
review: First impressions are really great for such an inexpensive hotel. Good sized room, bed, bath, biscuits left on the table. And a greaty location too, just a few minutes from the train station and the centre of town. Everything you could wish for for such a great price. There were two small drawbacks however - a) There's no Wifi anywhere in the hotel - I was told that there was in the reception area but this simply didn't work (if you have a computer they have a cable in the room for adsl access). and b) the variety of fruit in the breakfast area was not fresh fruit salad - in most hotels in Italy you get lovely fresh pineapple, melon etc. But these are small issues - overally really good value for money.

title: Great location from which to enjoy Florence.
review: we arrived to our hotel on oct 14th and stayed for 3 nights the location was great for us because it was soo close to the train station.. when we checked in the staff looked bored and were just monotone ..when we got up to our room it was small plain just whatever nothing to write home about but i really didn't mind as we weren't planning to spend much time in the room. ..oh one good thing is they had early check in thank god..when we freshened up we came back downstairs and one of the staff members gave us some restaurant recommendations so that was cool...when we finally called it a night and came back to our room was a bit stuffy so i tried to turn on the ac but it wouldnt work i looked everywhere to see if there was somewhere else i had to turn it on finally i gave up called…

title: Highly recommended
review: Spent a week in Florence at Hotel Adler Cavalieri and loved every minute of it.  Complimentary breakfast served by a courteous and attentive staff.  More American TV for after hours enjoyment than other hotels.  Close to city center, museums and other sites.  Concierge at the front desk was very helpful, getting us train tickets to Rome, some local restaurant recommendations, maps to the "must see" sites.  But my favorite part was spending the end of the day each day in the roof top bar with Bernardo, the affable bartender.  He really made us feel at home with his congeniality, observations, and friendly conversation.

title: Adler Cavalieri - a nice hotel in a convenient location.
review: Recently stayed a night at the Hotel Adler Cavalieri, if you are arriving in Florence by train this hotel is ideally situated - no more than 5 mins walk from the station.  Although the street is nothing extraordinary, the hotel itself is extremely comfortable, rooms are large and the bathrooms came with lots of freebies.  The reception staff were efficient.  There is also a bar (which is partly a terrace bar)  - very quiet on the Saturday night - but a nice venue to have an evening drink.  Breakfast was excellent, could not fault it.  All in all if re-visiting Florence we would certainly consider staying here again.

title: Very disappointed
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great for the price - but not for us
review: I was extremely disappointed considering this was a 4 star hotel. Beds were as hard as planks, tv's were tubes from the 60's, and the shower in the original room we were given was terrible. Carpet was dirty looking as was the comforter on the bed. After one night, we aksed for a different room or we were going to go to another hotel. If I paid for a 2 star motel, I wouldn't have been disappointed. Only good thing was that it was close to the train station.  Would not go back though.

title: Nice hotel near train station
review: This is a very nice hotel only 10-15 minutes walk into the city centre and very close to the train station. The area is the best but it isn't that bad either. The problem we had was that parking at the hotel costs 20 euro per day. We had to change our plans so that we made a better use of the car at another hotel outside the city with free parking. The staff was helpful and the breakfast was great. The rooms felt a bit dated but some could see it as charming. Overall I would recommend the hotel for people without cars or don't care about parking.

title: Great Stay
review: We only stayed at this hotel for one night, but had a very pleasant experience. It was extremely convenient to the train station, and right down a major road from the sights in the historic areas (15 minute walk). The front desk staff was very helpful and spoke great English. The room and bathroom were spotless. Our favorite part was the breakfast room which was near the garden and served some hot items.  The only drawback would be the surrounding neighborhoods. If you get off track, you may find yourself in a questionable area. However, there are many hotels on the street with this one.

title: Excellent hotel
review: We stayed in florence for 2 nights and had a very pleasant stay..The hotel is within walking distance to all the sights and the train station which was very convenient. The hotel was clean and the breakfast was very good.I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to other travelers.

title: Nice hotel - right by train station
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: excelent hotel, excelent location
review: This hotel is nice. It's very close to the train station, so it's perfect for anyone travelling by train. We had 2 rooms - our first one had a TINY bathroom. Second one was much better.  Staff was really great - but the location left a little to be desired. There was nothing around it - a couple of restaurants - that's it. The hotel itself does not have a restaurant. One great thing - they have SKY DISH which offers ENGLISH TV. Kinda spoled us for the rest of our trip.

title: Great hotel
review: we stayed for 4 nights in "Adler Cavalieri@. Everything was excelent (big room, big bathroom with toiletries, nice breakfast buffet, friendly service, clean and cosy). As location, every attraction is within walking distance. If you want to go to Pisa, take a train from the Santa Maria Novel railwaystation (2 minutes from hotel). You have 2-3 trains per hour. Buy your ticket for return as well,  so you can take any train you want. Just do not forget to validate your ticket on the platform befor boarding the train (yellow validating machine). Arriving to Pisa (about 1 hour and some minutes), buy bus ticketa (1 euro for 1 journey) at a tobacco shop in the station, than cross the street  and take LAM ROSSO bus (bus stop in front of a hotel). this bus will take you to Campo dei…

title: Très bon hôtel et bien situé, good hotel well situated
review: This hotel was very close to the train station.  Very convenient to walk to with our luggage.  The staff was very welcoming and attentive.  The room was clean, and the bathroom was very nice.  The fitness center was also nice.  The breakfast had a great selection of foods, even gluten free options! The hotel was about a 10 minute walk to the center of the city.  We ate in a couple of restaurants within 1 block of the hotel, as suggested by the hotel staff, and each place was very good. Overall, great location, clean, and great staff.  We were very happy with our stay.

title: ehh, not my ideal choice
review: We chose this hotel after reading everything on trip advisor, and we did well. We arrived late at night after our car had broken down in Parma, and were greeted warmly by the receptionist who immediately helped us to find a parking place in a garage close by. Our room was very spacious and we loved the old fashioned decoration. Exactly what one expects when staying in Florence. The hotel is very close to the center of Florence, no need to use a car. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Old World Charm with modern convenience
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Good for the price- not the safest location.
review: We recently spent four nights here and were extremely happy with the hotel and service.  Right near the train station and a short walk (less than 10 minutes) to the Duomo and center, it was convenient to everything including some excellent trattorias nearby. The hotel offers European old world charm and service combined with modern spacious bathrooms and conveniences. The staff was courteous, attentive and very helpful. They secured, for us, tickets  to the Uffizzi, so we had no wait whatsoever.  We loved the buffet breakfast with a great selection, the wood-paneled library, and the roof garden where cocktails and snacks were served in the late afternoon. We discovered the cocktail hour when another guest mentioned it. Although a small sign in the lobby and elevator advertises…

title: Good hotel -not exceptional, not terrible
review: We stayed here for 3 nights.  It is very close to the train station which is good for coming and going, but that also means that you are close to a lot of "sketchy" areas and what all the books warn you about pick-pocketing.  Also, it is not really close to anything but the train station, so it was a little walk to get to anything else- but Florence is small so it was usually fine if you don't  mind a walk.  We got a room with a garden terrace.  It was a beautiful terrace and very private.  The bathroom was fine, but the room was VERY small.  We had just enough room to walk around the bed.  Not even enough room for us to each have a place for our suitcase.  Breakfast was good and the free internet was a nice bonus.  Staff was helpful and booked us a great private tour of…

title: Wonderful Hotel with an Exceptional Staff
review: The hotel is in a great location -a 5 minute walk from the train station.  The directions given by the hotel, however, are terrible and not very clear.  The street on which the hotel is located is dark and for a single traveler, a little uncomfortable.  The hotel staff is businesslike and professional, though not overly friendly.  The rooms are a bit dated, though the bathrooms are clean and modern.  The hotel is safe, clean, and a good option for sightseeing.  Overall, if you're looking simply for a clean, safe hotel in a good location without amenities, close to the train station where you have easy access to tour bus pickup locations, this is a good option.  If you are staying for more than a couple of nights, are staying with kids or are an elderly traveler, this is probably…

title: THE BEST!!!
review: A wonderful hotel and definitely deserves its four star rating.  The staff was very friendly and helpful; and communicating in English was not a problem.  The reservation was in order and there were no extra charges.  The room was quite large for a European hotel in this price range and was very clean.  The bathroom was also spacious, modern and very clean.  There was no bathtub, only a shower stall.  The shower stall size was adequate but may be a little tight for very large people.  Our room had a terrace which we used for take-out dinner one night.  We got our dinners from a nearby “ristorante” recommended by the desk staff.   The air conditioner worked well, but was a little noisy for sleeping.  Breakfast was great.  Hot and cold food was offered and included traditional…

title: A nice Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Very good hotel_good location
review: We choose the hotel because of its proximity to the Station.  I only wish the directions given were accurate and that the hotel staff could have been more welcoming to assist with the bags.  Aside from the initial hiccup, the staff were good and polite. We stayed 2 nights.  The room was reasonable size,  nice, quiet with a terrace and the bathroom unusally large for a european hotel.  The breakfast was good with a wide choice of hot and cold items on the buffet.  There was free wireless internet.  The good thing about this hotel, and unique amongst all other european hotels, is the provision of free and free flow of coffee and biscuits after 11pm at the lobby. I would wake up at about 5 am to work with home office from the lobby and the coffee was a kind companion.  I was not…

title: Pleasant Stay
review: The hotel was in an excellent location (near the railway station & the centre). The breakfast was quite good and the room were lovely!

title: Glad I found this hotel
review: Appearances wise, this is the nicest hotel I stayed in while traveling in Italy.  The room is well decorated, the elevators were nice and worked, there were automatic doors at the entrance, and an automatic key card system.  There was a very large breakfast spread, although it wasn't necessarily attended to as fast as it could have been.  Some of the staff was more helpful than others, but overall, everything went well.  My biggest complaint was the road noise.  While the double windows definitely kept the noise out, we traveled during a fairly warm week in April, and needed to keep the windows open.  When the window was just cracked, the road noise was so loud I couldn't hear my husband talking right next to me.    Otherwise, Florence being the size that it is, we found all the…

title: Excellent
review: Just came back from Italy.  Stayed at this hotel for two nights, we had two rooms.  Both are very comfortable.  The hotel is 5min walking away from train station, about 10-20min walking from major attractions.   Florence isn't that big and safe in the evening, so not that bad.    It is on a bus street, but the double windows keep the noise down very well.  Our rooms were on second floor facing the street., no problem in the morning.  The neighborhood isn't the greatest, and also not many restaurants nearby, the one recommended by the hotel wasn't that great.    I would stay at this hotel again next time to Florence.

title: Great value and location. Friendly staff.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Absolutely Perfect
review: An elegant and friendly hotel near MSN the train station literally two blocks. Wonderful greeting in this smallelagant hotel. Romm very clean with good amenities. Prior reviewers have stated that the front desk staff was dismissive we found it to the contrary. They adjusted the room rate by ten Euros when I asked for a better price.

title: Super hotel
review: Just back from a fantastic trip to Tuscany.  We stayed in the Adler Cavalieri for the first two nights and can honestly say that we cant fault the hotel.  Just a five minute walk from the train station and within easy walking distance of all the attractions that Florence has to offer our stay was perfect.  The room was to the back of the hotel, overlooking a little courtyard,  it was spotless, spacious and a welcome haven after long days exploring the city.   Would recommend this hotel wthout hesitation and I am incredibly difficult to please, we will most definitely go back!

title: A nice play to stay but don't bring your car.
review: I stayed at the Adler Cavalieri for 4 nights during the PittiUomo fair.  The hotel met all my requirements which were sent via email.   I stayed in Room 205, which was large, clean and comfortable.  The bathroom was large and shower had good water pressure.   Loads of large fluffy towels and toiletries.  What I appreciated most about the room was the fact that the heating was not centrally controlled.   I was able to adjust it or switch it off completely.   I find a lot of hotel rooms in Europe too warm and one is unable to turn the heating down or off due to it being centrally controlled.   I wish I could find this in Milan!  There is an inroom safe, desk area, 3 chairs, fair amount of cupboard space, no coffee making facilities in Room 205, comfortable bed and free internet.  …

title: Great Hotel-Awesome Location
review: The hotel is fairly well situated and is close to the rail station. It is a reasonably close walk to the historical city centre. We had booked a triple room and were disappointed with the room that we were initially given. Compared to the one at Rome for essentially the same price, this one was very small with lighting so dim that it was not easy to do any reading, and it felt rather claustrophobic. The hotel seemed a bit old, too. It had a little terrace, but the view of the garden was amusingly limited to a single tree. We asked about a larger room and were given one without a terrace, but it was significantly more spacious with more light coming in, and we liked it. Although the street outside is quite busy with buses and scooters, once the windows are closed, no noise is…

title: Highly recommended
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Perfecto
review: The hotel is very short walk from Florence's central Santa Maria Novella train station and probably just less than a 10 minute walk into the centre of Florence.  There's a lot of hotels in the centre of Florence, but it's actually quite nice to escape the tourist hordes at the end of the day when you wander back to the hotel.    The hotel staff were very efficient and helpful and spoke very good English.  They are able to book you advance museum tickets if you haven't already done it yourself.  The hotel itself is full of old world charm, lots of dark wood, chesterfield couches etc.  The room was really charming as well, great comfy bed (if you like your bed on the firm side, which I do), painted fresco ceilings, and, not that you'll probably spend that much time in Italy…

title: Inconsistent Room Price
review: We stayed 2 nights for the honey moon..Sept. 28 & 29,2008. It;s very romantic, the room very large (for italian hotel) and very clean. Shampoo, Soap and lotion were perfectly choosen. Staff very helpful. The breakfast is ok. Internet service very good and general ambiance excellent.   Verry Verry Good.

title: Loved the Adler Cavalieri
review: I traveled into Florence at the last minute and called a few hotels.  The Adler C. had a room available - double room, single occupant for 140Euro.  This is about the average rate for this area - close to the City Center for a standard hotel.  I ended up needing to stay an extra day and asked at the desk if they had a room available for the additional night.  The answer was yes that they did, but the price was different - now 195Euro!  The reason given was that the rate the day before was a special walk in rate.  That's ridiculous - Felt a lot like gouging to me.  I walked down the street one block and got a room at the Rivoli Hotel for less than the first rate at the Adler - for just as nice a room and just as nice a hotel.

title: LOVED the Alder
review: Dear Tripadvisor reviewer, I am sorry, but I don’t understand what your point is.  Let me just make this clear. The first night you paid € 140,00 which was the rate for a single room, but we upgraded your reservation and gave you a double room without any extra charge.  After the first night, you decided to stay an extra night. As yours was the only double room available, we quoted a higher rate, the same one that was posted on the internet. The price was not as absurd as you think, because we sold that room ( last one available ) at an higher price we gave you, only  40 minutes after your check-out. Best regards.   Riccardo Ceseri – General Manager

title: Hotel with big rooms but not modern
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great Place & Great Location
review: The location of this hotel is good, but not excellent. You must walk 15/20 min to reach the center of the city (Uffizi galeries and Vecchio Bridge). The breakfast is very good and the concierges are nice and helpfull. The rooms and bathrooms are very big, but we would prefer a more modern interior design.  Overall, it's a good choice for a pleasant stay in this fantastic city!

title: Great Hotel
review: We stayed here for 4 nights, and the experience was excellent. For euro hotels the room was spacious and kept to a high standard. Only minor point was that they are strict about no ironing in the room and no in room tea/coffee in normal double rooms.  However if you are travelling with a laptop they provide free internet in the rooms (decent speed ~2mbps) ask at reception for pass code.  Its less than a 5min walk from the station, so is a perfect base for visiting florence and surrounding towns/cities. The italian train system is cheap and v.reliable. While there we visitied places like Pisa (1hr) and Viareggio (beaches 1hr 20mins) by train.  Also the staff are very friendly and it is based near a variety of restaurants/bars and clubs.

title: Great Experience
review: Wife and I stayed in Florence for 3 days in July.  As others have said, the hotel is right next to the train station (make sure you exit the station to the right after getting off the train).  More importantly, all the sights are well-within walking distance.  The hotel itself was very nice; clean rooms, nice bathrooms, helpful staff.  All of the staff I encountered spoke English very well, and didn't seem to resent having to do so.  The breakfast was very good, with a good combination of European treats and American standards.  All in all, a very comfortable stay and one I would highly recommend to anyone planning to travel to Florence.

title: Wonderful Stay
review: I and my wife loved our 3 night stay at Adler Cavalieri.   We arrived by at Florence by train from Rome. Hotel is close to the station: we had no trouble walking to the hotel with once piece luggage each.   Room was well furnished, bathrooms have modern fittings. Breakfast with hot choices was a good start each morning - we later stayed at a more expensive hotel in Rome with all cold/frozen breakfast choices. Our room (#113) even had a private walkout nook/balcony.   All attractions in city center are a few minutes walk from the hotel. Staff were very helpful: helped get tickets for Pisa tour and getting us a printed a train schedule from the web for our return trip. We wish we would have utilized them fro tickets to Ufizi gallery and avoided more than an hour in the line on day…

title: Best European Hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: a few things about the Adler Cavalieri
review: I just got back from a two week trip to Italy.  Originally, I had planned on only spending 5 nights in Florence.  After only 3 nights in "Firenze", I decided to stay for the majority of my trip there, after I fell in love with the city, and with my hotel.    The hotel is located extremely close to the train station, and within walking distance of everything the city has to offer.  I stayed for 11 nights at the hotel, and the price of the room varied between $110 to $140, depending on the night.  The avg. cost per night during my stay, was around $127.00  For a European hotel, the size of my room was larger than what I expected.  The bathroom was extremely modern, and the daily breakfast served was very good.  I can't compliment the Hotel Staff enough.  They all spoke english…

title: Great Hotel
review: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Adler Cavalieri last month. And although I have to say that at first I wasn't sure about what to expect, at the end of my 3-day stay I came to the conclusion that this hotel may very well rank among the best hotels I've ever been in.  This was a very special occasion for me and my wife - our first vacation together since being tranferred to Rome from Los Angeles. Anyway First let me say that the room we stayed in had a very lovely terrace overlooking a nice garden.  The bathroom was covered with beautiful marbles and had a  wood ceiling. Breakfast was served in charming little austrian cafè-like room. Food was fresh and the staff very friendly and attentive A special thanks, though, to the amazing staff of the reception desk. They really made…

title: No complaints
review: This is a great hotel located in the heart of Florence, right next door to the train station. The room was large and very clean, the bathroom was very impressive. The staff were helpful and friendly and helped my wife and I to obtain tickets to watch the local football team, Fiorentina, play. They also charged my ipod for me when the battery had run out!  The breakfast bar was superb and included both hot and cold food and guests were entitled to eat as much as they liked.  The free gym was also very useful and had modern technology, for a fee guests can even gave a sauna or massage.  This is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in and I would definately recommend it to anybody planning a trip to the wonderul city of Florence.

title: Comfortable Hotel in Florence
review: We stayed at the hotel for two days in the middle of March.  We were surprised as to how big our room was.  The bathroom was rather nice too.  The breakfast buffet was pretty good and had plenty of food.  The location was close to the train station which was nice since we arrived in Florence via train.  We also walked everywhere in Florence and it wasn't a far stroll from anywhere.  The hotel even loaned us a laptop so that we coud check our e-mail and check in with family.  The staff was helpful and very friendly.  I would recommend.

title: This is a wonderful hotel and a great value.
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great hotel, convenient location
review: We loved the Adler Cavalieri.  We had a great room, with a lovely bathroom.  The hotel had an excellent breakfast buffet and helpful staff.  The hotel is next to the train station - very convenient for us as we were traveling through Italy by train.  I'd recommend it to anyone.

title: very nice hotel
review: We stayed in this hotel in September 2007 and I forgot to write a review, but I think the hotel deserve to be recommended.  There are countless hotels and accommodation in Florence and it is very difficult to pick up one.  We selected this hotel on line, after having checked out many reviews and I was fearful of what we could have found.  It was selected mainly because it is close to the station and we were travelling by train, but it is also within walking distance to the city, so the location is excellent.  The building is old, (like most in the area) but the hotel is nicely refurbished and very clean.  We had a room at the back of the building, near a courtyard, and it was very quiet.  The bathroom was very nice and spacious, the bed comfortable and the wardrobe had a nice…

title: Highly recommended
review: Stayed here in October 2007.  Was a very nice hotel, though a bit outdated.  They had parking, which was the main feature for us.  It is in a good location, close to everything and easy to find by car.  The staff was very helpful with restaurant suggestions, so ask them, they know what they are talking about!

title: A wonderful hotel
review: This hotel is so handy to the train station that my son and I walked too far when we arrived and tried to find it - it is literally a small block away. It is about a 10-15 minute stroll to the highlights on most people's must-see lists.  I stayed for a week with my 5 year old son and found it great; in particular, the full buffet breakfast (hot and cold) was the best in our 3 week stay in Italy and managed to suit the fussy tastes of my son. The bathroom was modern and well-stocked, the rate reasonable (over Christmas), and the staff courteous (I amended my booking upon arrival and it was no problem whatsoever). I would definitely stay here again.

title: Very Nice Hotel with great views of the courtyard on the second floor!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Happy campers at the Adler Cavalieri
review: We stayed at the Adler Cavalieri in April for our honeymoon and had a wonderful experience.  We are walkers, so the location was fine for us.  The rooms were very clean and fairly large by European standards.  There breakfast was fantastic as well.  We would definitely stay at the Adler again.

title: Decent hotel.  But don't stay in a room downstairs.
review: I've never written an online review for a hotel -- I've just never had an experience bad enough or good enough to warrant the time and trouble. Until now. I was very pleased with my five-night stay at the Adler in Florence. I selected the hotel based on these reviews, with a little concern because of the negatives ones. But my visit was solid in all respects for a hotel of this caliber. The location was wonderful -- around the corner from the train station and the bus from the airport as well as on a bus line that took us from the hotel block to the Ponte Vecchio in under 10 minutes. We also enjoyed two meals at a restaurant 1 1/2 blocks away -- can't think of the name of the place the hotel recommended. Rooms were nice and clean (good cable TV with some channels in English),…

title: Loved the Adler Cavalieri Florence
review: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights while on our honeymoon.  The room we had was quaint, small, but nice.  The bathroom was very nice and clean.  The staff were somewhat helpful.  The breakfast was decent.  It had a good variety.  The only issue I had with this place was the room we had... I believe it was #8.  It was downstairs not far from the front desk.  Our room had hardwood floors, as did the upstairs room.  So we could hear the upstairs neighbors as they walked back and forth all night long.   We could hear the all the flushing of toilets and shower of the neighbor next door.  And being downstarirs, the maid starts cleaning there first, so we were not able to sleep in at all, because of the banging of the maid as she cleaned in the room next to us.  If there are…

title: A Memorable Experience
review: Adler Cavalieri Florence We stayed at this hotel 2nd to the 5th November 2007. This is a very good city centre hotel, and would have no hesitation in making a recommendation to any experienced traveller. The hotel is situated within 150m of the main train station (Santa Maria Novella), is clean, comfortable, and very good value. All the main sites are within walking distance for a reasonably fit person.   We award this hotel top marks. This is based on considering all factors (city location – expect traffic noise, smaller rooms), good breakfast (not great – but then we did not pay for great), and especially the overall cost.  If you need Burj Al Arab standards (with McDonalds prices), this is not the place for you.   The Ill Gardino restaurant opposite the hotel is worth a…

title: Very nice hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: WOnderful hotel in Florence
review: Very nice hotel in Florence.  Front desk staff was especailly helpful.  The room was of a very good size and was quite comfortable.  Location of the hotel is decent, have to walk a little bit to get to the main part of town, but wasn't far at all.  Hotel is also close to train station which was nice.  Not a lot going on right outside the hotel, so expect to walk 5 or 10 minutes to get to where you want to go, but I would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent hotel and location!
review: Wonderful hotel located two blocks from the train station. Staff was very helpful. Our room had a small patio with table and chairs. Great restaurants are located within walking distance. Staff would always make reservations.

title: So close to the train station
review: We just got back and must say we really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were alot bigger than normal and had a nice view of the courtyard. Everything in the room worked fine and the breakfast was better than expected. The location was excellent and were able to walk everywhere. Lots of restaurants near by and of course, so close to the train station. We will be staying here next year.

title: Will not return
review: We stayed at the Adler Cavalieri in July for two nights. We then left a suitcase there and headed to the Cinque Terre, where one doesn't want to have too much luggage (with all those steps!), and returned five days later for one more night. The hotel is only a very short walk from the station and the walk into Florence itself is easy. The hotel was absolutely fine, but we found our first room very dark and dull (with all that dark furniture). Our second room had a view over a small courtyard and was much more pleasant. I would agree about the front desk people. We were barely welcomed and then encouraged to book tickets for the various museums. As we have been to Florence several times before, we declined. However, my husband went to the Accademia, walked straight in and said…

title: Average hotel in Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great hotel and location
review: Stayed at this hotel for three nights after seeing the excellent reviews on tripadvisor and therefore having high expectations.  Unfortunately did not find this hotel to be that good, more like an average three star than a four star.  The staff were quite abrupt and bordering on rude when we arrived and the room was not as comfortable as other four star hotel rooms.  There was a big breakfast selection, but none of it was tasty and the coffee was poor quality.  Should be reclassified as a three star.

title: Great Hotel
review: I stayed at this hotel the 24th and 25th of june 2007. Florence was the second stop of my trip wich also included stops at Rome (Best Western Mundial) and  Venice (Hotel Rialto).   Althoug all of the other hotels I stayed at were also 4 stars standard, I have to say that this place was the best of all.   Very, I mean, very close to the train station (less then 3 minutes walk) this is very convenient for anybody traveling by train as you don't have to carry your luggage and loose your way in many small streets before getting to your hotel as this happen often.  To hotel itself is very clean, the room are big considering the European standards and it has a lot to offer. There is a magnifique inside garden where breakfast is served (see picture). By the way, I had my best…

title: La Loggetta at the Adler Cavalieri
review: This is an excellent hotel. The location is great and within walking distance of the major attractions and some excellent resteraunts. The staff are helpful and the rooms clean and well equipped. The sheets were changed every two days and there were nice little touches such as slippers in the room and mints at reception.  The breakfast was excellent however be sure to wait to be seated as the staff do get a little upset if you don't. The American Bar was beautiful and a great spot to unwind after a days walking. Bernardo the bar person is great and was friendly and efficient. We just loved this hotel and would  stay there again.

title: Wonderful Hotel!
review: My daughter and I stayed at this lovely, air conditioned apartment that is owned by the Adler Cavalieri. It is located a few steps away from the hotel on first floor. It comes is  with a fully equiped small kitchen, telephone, a large sitting area, bedroom, and an outdoor area. The outdoor part was unsuitable for sitting as it had lots of mosquitoes and was kind of dark. People who live in the other apartments can also look down at you, however who wants to sit around when there's so much to see in Florence. The apartment is central to major sites and we walked everywhere. The apartment is extremely quiet, and guests can use the hotel's amenities. Whenever we needed anything, the front desk was absoultely the most helpful. Our towels and kitchen garbage were changed daily. Phone…

title: Very nice place
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: excellent hotel
review: You get what you pay for.  Very close to the train station and just a very nice hotel.  More than we wanted to pay but we were quite pleased.  The staff is nice, the breakfast is great.  The wine bar inside the hotel was a great place to unwind after a long day.   We got a room in the back and it was super quiet.  We would recommend this to our friends.

title: Old World Charm
review: Excellent hotel,   good location near station, every important tourist site nearby, rooms v ery good, breakfast very good

title: Wonderful hotel
review: Pros:  Hotel Adler Cavalieri is located 20 minutes by bus from the airport (4,50 Euro each way) and is a short walk from the train/bus station.  The reception and hotel staff was pleasant and helpful.  In answer to my e-mails they got us reserved tickets to Uffizi and Accademia.  They charge a fee on each ticket for this service, but it saved us from waiting in long lines in the heat. The reception area, reading room, breakfast room and bar were clean, nicely decorated and inviting. Our room on the 3rd floor overlooked the courtyard and was clean, quiet and the windows opened.  The room had a comfortable king size bed and a large wardrobe that had shelves on one side, an in-room safe, and 3 small drawers.  The other side of the wardrobe had ample room for hanging clothes. There…

title: Loved the Adler
review: We stayed in Hotel Alder Cavlaieri in Florence for two nights in late April 2007. The hotel was absolutely fabulous. The reception staff were so helpful and polite. As we took a direct coach from Pisa airport to Florence, the hotel was very conveniently located; close to the train/ bus station (but very quite as well).  The room was absolutely  first class; very clean, well equipped, excellent air condition, tastefully decorated and it had a king-size bed. The bathroom was first-rate; fully tiled, power shower and a lot of attention to the details. There were some great facilities in the hotel like Sauna, American bar and beautiful lounge. The breakfast was excellent; plenty to choose from. This is a great and wonderful hotel. We will recommend it to any visitors to this…

title: Quiet place in a busy city
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Convenient Location
review: Room #4 had a small terrace with table and chairs in a quiet garden.  This was just one of many things that made this hotel a hit with us including a great breakfast, easy access to the train station, staff who were friendly and made great restaurant recommendations.

title: Great Stay!
review: We booked this hotel on Venere.com and was very happy with the choice.  There were some mixed review on the tripadvisor website which made me a little nervous after I booked it.  But once we arrived, all the worrying was unfounded.  The walk to the hotel from the Florence train station was less than 10 minutes with our 2 large suitcases.  Lisa (brunette) check us in and was extremely nice and informative.  Unfortunately, not the entire staff is as helpful because we found very difference service level from various staff members.  The room and bathroom was huge and we had a room in the back facing a small private courtyard.  Breakfast was good with a variety of fruits, pastry, yogurt, cheese and coldcuts.  Unfortunately, their cafe latte was not very good.    The location of the…

title: First class hotel and experience
review: On the Florence leg of our (me and my beau) Italy trip, we stayed in Hotel Adler Cavalieri.  I didn't book this so I was apprehensive at first - the exterior of the hotel does no justice.    We got in by train and walked a few blocks to the hotel. Once inside, I was really impressed with the decor. The lady in the front desk was "frosty" at first but warmed up after we tried to check-in in Italian. Fortunately, we didn't get to deal with her the rest of the stay. The other staff was just lovely.    Our room over looked a courtyard/garden and we could hear birds and the bells of the not-so-distant Duomo. The room was okay in size and was well decorated (the best in all of our Italy hotels). The bathroom was huge and the toiletries were fabulous.  For a short stay this hotel is…

title: Not Impressed with Adler Cavalieri
review: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Adler cavalieri hotel for 4 nights in march and have only praise for it! The hotel is located down a quiet (ish) road near the train station which is perfect if you're flying to/from Pisa and it only costs around 5 euros each one way.   The staff are available around the clock and are extremely helpful with recommendations, directions etc. We also needed to change rooms when we got there as there was a slight booking error (see below) but this was sorted with zero fuss.  The room itself was a superior one as it had a jacuzzi bath, which is what it says on the website, but you actually have a choice of a terrace OR a jacuzzi, so just check you've got the correct one when you get there (we were given a terraced room initially but it wouldnt have…

title: Don't be discouraged by the outside
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great Hotel Stay
review: I had tried to select hotels using Rick Steve's book, but they were all full and time was running out.  I used a map and the reviews here to make a choice.  As we made the very short walk from the train station to the hotel, we were a bit worried about the area.  The outside of the hotel is very plain.  Once you enter the lobby, you enter a different world.  Warm tones, rich carpets, friendly staff.  It was delightful.  Our room was very cosy, comfortable beds.  We had a turkish bath the first night - pricey but hugely valuable as I had twisted my knee that morning.  The bathroom was typical European, quite small.  But there was plenty of hot water.  The complimentary breakfast was divine.  The coffee was terrific.  They served real food - eggs, meats, fruit and breads. The…

title: Fabulous
review: Stayed here last March for three nights & had a very positive experience.   Good location near the train station, Very clean, Great Breakfast buffet, while having a local self serve laundry, & several internet cafe's nearby.  Staff was also very helpful in recommending local restaurants.  Only minor problem was confusion in getting museum reservations. After asking the hotel twice ( thru email ) to get us bookings at Accademia & Uffizi and receiving no response....I booked them myself. When we arrived they had a duplicate booking.......No Problem things worked out  No Question....would Definitely stay here again !!!

title: Great Hotel!
review: We only had one night in Florence but where able to check in early and even had no problems checking out late the next day when we got delayed. After a fairly average hotel in Rome we where so excited when we saw our room as it was really modern. The girl on the front desk was absolutely lovely and gave us heaps of info. We even felt comfortable having a nice relaxing bath as the room was so clean. The breakfast the next morning was unbelievable, everything you could think of so my hubby went nuts and totally overate!! :) We absolutely loved Florence and this hotel made it extra special. Really close to the train and easy walking distance to the sites, shops and restaurants.

title: A Perfect Stay
review: I loved this hotel! It's convenient location, friendly staff and comfortable rooms made our stay at the Adler perfect.  I traveled here for only 1 day in September with my boyfriend; the hotel was chosen for it's close proximity to the train station, and it's positive reviews.  The bathroom was clean and spacious, and the bed was very comfortable.  The room was very spacious and we had a beautiful view of a garden below.  The included breakfast in the morning was also very nice.  We didn't have to walk for more than 15 minutes to get anywhere, and we had lots of restaurants to choose from within a 5 minute walking distance. I can't say anything bad about this hotel - it fit the bill perfectly!

title: Wonderful Experience
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: great hotel
review: Our 4 night stay at the Hotel was a great experience for first time travelers to Italy. The hotel is centrally located in the heart of the city, close to all the transportation (train, car rentals, and busses.) you need to travel around Florence and the surrounding countryside. The staff was very helpful in helping us to find what ever we needed. The desk staff were very helpful especially Lisa 1 and Lisa 2. (See attached photo.) I have recommended this hotel to my friends if and when they travel to Florence.

title: Comfortable stay
review: This was a great hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bathroom was spacious and the double bed was a double bed- not two twins pushed together. It was not right in the middle of the main squares so it was quieter.

title: Perfect fit
review: I spent 3 nights in this hotel with my sister in mid October. Very nice, quiet hotel. I booked thru hotels and contacted the hotel directly about a month before my arrival to be sure we had twin beds. The hotels kindly assigned us to a triple so we had twin beds plus a sofa and the room was very large. Even though the room was at the front of the hotel, the soundproffed windows worked great. The bathroom was modern, large and had great hot water. There was a whirlpool tub but we never had a chance to try it. The beds were very comfortable with freshly pressed sheets daily. Excellent lighting. The breakfast was very good but disorganized - all three mornings they ran out of eggs and replenishment was slow in coming (I ate at different times each day). Canned fruit salad but…

title: A Gem - A Wonderful Hotel
review: Loved our three nights at the Adler! The hotel is small with a wonderful ambiance. The staff is friendly and attentive. The rooms are not large but have beautiful details..such as artistically painted ceilings and beautiful wood furnishings. The hotel has several sitting areas which provided opportunities for us to mingle with other guests. Breakfast was delicious. The hostess knew us by the second day and anticipated our needs. You can walk anywhere in Florence from here but I was happy to have my husband at my side since you do pass the train station where as most train stations do...there were some local men "hanging out". The only down side... The rooms on  the street are noisy due to traffic but they provide two sets of exterior windows which muffle the sounds. Besides..you…

title: A Wonderful Experience
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Grazie Adler Cavalieri
review: The Adler staff is helpful and friendly. Franco will answer any questions you have by email.  The location of the hotel is conveniently situated to all major attractions.  Our room was spacious,clean, and well appointed.  Chocolate and slippers were among the amenities.  I recommend this place without reservation.

title: gross and expensive
review: We stayed at this lovely Hotel at the end of September, in a spacious room with a balcony and elegant furniture. The hotel is close to the train station and just a few minutes from the pontevechio, the domo and all the other wonderful monuments of this city. The staff at the front desk was very kind and helpful, they got us tickets for the Uffizi and Akademia galleries (wich was really convenient since the queues were awfully long) and they gave us some really good recommendations about where to go in Florence. They also made us a reservation at a very pretty restaurant called the culinario club osvaldo, near the santa croce church. The breakfast was delicious and rich. The Hotel looked very clean and the atmosphere was very quiet and relaxing.  We really loved Florence and this…

title: Good Choice
review: maybe we got the one disgusting room in the hotel, but i am very surprised by the positive reviews listed here. the location near the train station was convenient for us and we didn't find it to be dangerous. our problem was the room itself. ours was old and nasty. i didn't want to touch the bedspread or the carpet. we were on the first floor behind the reception desk, so perhaps the rooms upstairs are nicer. i thought it was completely overpriced and i would not stay there again.

title: Good base for sightseeing Florence
review: The Adler is a good property overall.   We were given a room with a private terrace which was lovely.  Is is located by the train station and only a 5-10 minute walk into town.  IF you wakll out of the hotel and make a quick right and then your first left, you are in the hottest part of town in 5 minutes.   We did see a mozzie in our room, but the management took care of it.  To be fair, we saw a ton of mozzies all over Florence so I can't imagine it is jsut this hotel.  The front desk staff is beyond helpful, they mapped out the best driving path to Sienna and recommended lots of wineries on the way.   I woudl stay here again!

title: Wonderful...A Gem
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Mosquitoes and lack of cleanliness
review: The room was spacious and extremely clean.  The staff  was helpful and friendly.  Access to the train and sights was great.

title: The Adler is a Gem.
review: I'll try to keep this as short as possible as there are so many negative things about this hotel.  I don't want the next person trying to find a hotel in Florence close to the train station to waste their money.  DIRTY - the carpet near and in the elevator had large stains and the carpet did not look like it had been cleaned in quite some time.   MOSQUITOES - I left the hotel the next morning with 6, yes I said 6, mosquito bites all over my body.  My husband killed a few before we went to bed, but apparently that wasn't enough.  HANDICAP ACCESSIBILITY - we took the elevator to our room, which barely fit myself, my husband and the bellhop and then walked down a long hall and then down 3 steps and down another hall to get to our room. HALF DOOR ON SHOWER - it makes quite a mess of…

title: Omni-Good hotel and great location
review: We stayed there for 4 nights last week (sept 7-11). This hotel was a real gem. We had excellent service in a very comfortable room that had ample space. The bed was nice and firm and the shower had great water pressure. The housekeepers turned down our beds each night and provided us with slippers. We enjoyed sitting on the tropical patio after talking with the wonderful bartender, Bernardo. All of the staff spoke English well and had a wonderful restaurant recommendation - Club Culinario Toscano de Osvaldo. This was a very romantic, very accessible hotel, close to the train station (but not too close) and a good choice for anyone who wants a nice hotel in Firenze.

title: An OK stay
review: I actually had a booking with a different hotel, but was moved to Hotel Adler Cavalieri, which turned out to be great.  The hotel is a short walk from the train station and a couple of great restaurants, including a small Italian restaurant and a steak house, which had great prices and service (just ask the reception desk for their recommendation).  I was also able to get tickets to various museums from the front desk, which was key to avoid standing in the long lines all day.  Although the hotel's bar was on the pricey side, there is an Irish pub a few blocks away, which had a great atmosphere and prices.  If you don't mind being away from high tourist traffic, this hotel is great.  My only complaint is that the shower is quite small.  P.S. Beware of food that you order from…

title: Attack of the Mozzie
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great price performance
review: Booked for 3 nights stay at this hotel in August after reading some of the reviews here.  However didn't find this hotel to be worth the money - mainly due to its location in the most dangerous part of the city, and the condition of the room.  What was worst was the nightly raid by the many mozzies in the room! The hotel seemed to be aware of this problem and offered a can of anti-mozzie replellent for use in the room and at the front desk!

title: Loved Adler Cavalieri
review: I haven't never answered to an opinion of one of our guest, but I need to explain that the photo encloded ( dead mozzie ) doesn't show one of our rooms or a public area of our property.

title: Loved it!
review: Great location.  The hotel is very close to the Florence SMN train station.  There are numerous internet cafes, laundry shops and bars on the same street. Friendly staff.  I booked my entrance tickets to Galleria dell'Accademia and Uffizi with concierge.  Buffet breakfast included different kinds of ham, cereals, fruits, breads, eggs and pastries.  I had reserved a double room.  It was compact but still big enough to have space for our 2 pieces of 26-inch luggages.  Felt like the restroom was recently renovated.  Generous with bath supplies ( i.e. shampoo and soaps).  Great price performance.  I would stay at this same hotel if I need to go back to Florence.

title: Fantastic Hotel- Highly Recommended!
review: Stayed here early July.  Excellent location, friendly, helpful staff at front desk and beautiful room.  Only criticism was the price of drinks in the hotel bar, but plenty of cheaper bars in vicinity.

title: Wonderful
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Lovely Hotel with Wonderful Staff
review: The Adler is an oasis. We stayed here July 9-12, 2006 and I was overjoyed at my experience there.  Hotel desk staff were excellent, going the extra mile to help, e.g., phoning ahead to various properties to help us make reservations at our next stop. Our room was clean, quiet and nicely appointed. Marble bath was lovely. The "matrimonial" bed was comfortable: enough support for her, enough give for him.   The location can't be beat for arrivals from or departures to the train station, just a 5 minute walk, and/or arrival via bus from the airport (2 minute walk). Walks into the city center are a minimum 10 minutes from the hotel, not a major issue.  The neighborhood in which the hotel is located is not the greatest, but I never, ever felt a safety concern when walking in the area…

title: Below Average Service
review: After being in Rome for 3 days with a mediocre hotel, we arrived at the Adler.  It is just a few minutes from the train station; great location.  The hotel itself is lovely. Clean, great rooms and all decorated nicely. The best part was the front desk staff, particularly the concierge.  I had corresponded with him prior to our trip to arrange for a car to drive us to the beach resort, Viareggio.  He handled all the details carefully and provided us with a very nice driver, who spoke english, and drove us to the best beach area. We had a wonderful relaxing day. The staff helped make our brief stay absolutely wonderful. We would definitely return!!

title: loved it
review: We weren't thrilled with this hotel.  Our biggest complaint was the unfriendly attitude at the front desk.  We politely asked a few quick questions on two occasions and felt as though we were bothering them.  One night we came back to our room to find that we were out of soap.  I went to the front desk to ask for some and the man I asked muttered something, made me wait about 10 minutes for someone else to bring it to the front desk, and then handed me the soap without a word.  I suppose he could have been muttering about how the hotel staff should have left some soap in the room, but I thought the situation deserved at least a simple, "Sure, no problem" when I asked for the soap or "Sorry about that" when he handed it to me.  Either one would have sufficed.  We asked them if…

title: not good value for money
review: We stayed here as a family of 5 and this was our favorite hotel.  Service was excellent and location is very near the train station.  I would recomend this hotel to anyone!

title: A great hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Just the facts, Ma'am
review: I stayed here for 2 nights.  The hotel is really nice with excellent attention to detail and friendly staff.  I forgot to fill out my breakfast card on the first day however my turndown service provided the card on my pillow to remind me.  They also greet you with chocolates and a map of Florence.  The rooms are light and airy, clean, quiet and in a convenient location.  I loved the large bathroom and the extra large bathroom sink.  Next time I return to Florence I'm staying here again.

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: This is a very well appointed hotel located in a convenient spot: it is 3 minutes from the train/bus station.  It is a 10-15 minute walk into the center of Florence.  There is a self-service laundromat just down the block.  Two blocks away are several restaurants (try La Rotunda Firenze, a pizzeria just across from the trattoria stuffed with tourists - better food, half price, dine with the locals). The rooms are quite large and amenities, ie slippers, robes, etc, very nice.  The hotel has obviously been updated, including the 'fresco' on the room ceilings. Probably due to the remodeling the windows are double paned so the room remains quiet, despite any outside noise.  The staff is extremely accomodating and has a good level of English.  Breakfast includes hot and cold items…

title: Wonderful
review: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for three nights in late May 2006. The room was gorgeous, the service was outstanding. The location is good. It is only a short walk to all that Florence has to offer. Our room was nicely decorated with a painted ceiling and the bathroom had a typical toilet/bidet/shower set up that you will find in many Itlalian hotels. But the difference in or room is that the bathroomm was spacious and did not feel claustrophobic. If you need to do some laundry there is a laundromat three doors down. And, don't miss the Pharmacia at the convent of Santa Maria Novella just down the street. Behind inconsipcuous doors is an interesting and beautiful shop wher the convent sells perfumes, tinctures, and other naturropathic products. Really cool.

title: Best Sleep, GREAT Location
review: Extremely friendly and helpful service people at the desk.  Nice room (even though we didn't have a balcony like some other reviewers).  We only stayed one night and had to leave very early the next morning and therefore the breakfast area was not yet open.  Get this though:  they packed us up a bag of goodies for breakfast to take with us!!!!  It was basically crackers with jam, cookies, a piece of fruit and a bottle of water and juice.  All the same, it was a incredibly nice service and reflects the kindness felt at the hotel.  If we are lucky to get back to Florence, we will book here again.  No further searching needed!

title: Highly recommended!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: An awesome hotel!
review: This was a fabulous hotel with excellent service and very friendly and helpful staff. Ideally located very near to the train & bus station, getting around is no problem. To give you an idea, my girlfriend and I walked to the P.Vecchio in about 15-20mins. Good value for money!

title: Terrific Hotel
review: This hotel was the best we stayed at in Italy.  It was easy walking distance from the train station.  The staff was wonderful & spoke english very well.  The room was beautiful and updated with a new painted ceiling, marble bathroom, & keycard entry.  We stayed in room 112 which was in a unique spot in the hotel making the bathroom very big and allowing for a private terrace - which not many rooms had.  Breakfast was included in the price and even included scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, meats, cheeses, cereal, pastries, etc.  They also recently added some spa services at the hotel which we unfortunately did not have the chance to take advantage of.  Even though the hotel was updated, it had a lot of old world Italian charm with patios with flowers and fountains hidden within…

title: Excellent value for Europe
review: Loved the Adler, conveniently situated within 5 minutes of the Station and about a 10-12 minute walk to the Duomo.  Fabulous room with a beautiful bathroom and a small balcony (big enough for two) overlooking a secluded private courtyard where a sumptuous breakfast can be eaten.  Genuinely friendly, helpful staff and all English-speaking.  Highly recommended.

title: Great hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Adler Cavalieri - What a pleasant surprise!
review: The location was excellent for this hotel and the quality of the service, the breakfast and room cleanliness were superb. However don't go to Florence in May-WAY too many tourists...I think its much nicer in the Autumn/Winter.

title: The Reviews Are Right
review: We booked our stay at the Adler thru a search engine after reading a few good reviews here.  None of the reviews I read actually described the hotel interior or the rooms, and frankly, when you look at the hotel facade it doesn´t really tell you much about what´s inside. Before we traveled, I e-mailed the hotel and asked for help with tours.  Andrea, one of the front desk officers, was kind enough to send me about 10 e-mails with information on the area, tours, etc.  Needless to say, when we checked-in, he was the one who welcomed us and informed us that he had everything ready and booked for us, gave us tickets and told us where to meet the tour guide (about 2 blocks from the hotel).  When we arrived at our room, I instantly felt transported to La Belle Epoque.  Although the…

title: Very nice hotel indeed
review: The reviews on this site are correct - great location near the train station, convenient to all sights, clean, great breakfast, and nice rooms. Staff is very helpful and friendly.   On a side note, for dinner, try Il Latini...

title: Best Hotel in Florence
review: We were very happy with our stay at the Adler. The rooms were spacious and comfortable, the bathrooms were extremely clean and modern. The front rooms (facing the street) have double windows so the noise from the street was non-existant with them shut. I think it *might* get a little hot in the summer with them closed all the time, but we didn't test the AC to see if it worked, it was so beautiful when we were there.  The breakfast that comes with the room was very very good- standard continental breakfast with the addition of really tasty italian cold cuts, scrambled eggs, and sausages. It was a great start every morning.  The hotel staff was very friendly, and spoke enough English to be very helpful. The server at breakfast was very attentive, and after the first morning,…

title: Glad we changed to this hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella.
