title: Great Hotel
review: We had booked another hotel used by a large package holiday operator, but after reading a Tripadvisor review we cancelled it in favour of the Adler Cavalieri. We were glad we did. We travelled by train and the hotel is conveniently close to the station and well located for most sites. The staff were welcoming and we had a super large, clean and quiet double room with a good sized bathroom. The room rate, incl a good breakfast -was excellent value for a 4* hotel. We could not fault the Adler Cavalieri and would love to return.

title: Highly recommended hotel
review: Good location for city and railway station. On a busy road but quiet in hotel. Asked for room change due to noise from air conditioning and staff very helpful. Very clean good size rooms. Public rooms and bars pleasant.

title: The Adler felt like home...
review: Hotel Adler Cavalieri has a great location, close to the rail and bus stations and in easy walking distance of the Historical centre of Firenze.  The staff are superb - helpful and friendly - as are the rooms which are clean, spacious and comfortable. Also very near to some excellent restaurants [go where the locals go and not the ones aimed at tourists!] Highly recommended and would definitely stay there again if I return to Florence!

title: Awesome Awesome Hotel
review: I had the pleasure of staying at the Adler for almost a month last June. It truly was my home away from home. Not only was it convenient as it was my home base for all my excursions in and out of the city, but it truly felt like my home.  The rooms were efficiently comfortable - all clean, modern and no useless space. Again, remember I was there for weeks and never felt crowded or in need of more space. The beds were comfortable; the rooms clean, the bathrooms were immaculate and all remodeled.   The staff was incredible. The front desk team was always accommodating, friendly and extremely helpful in booking reservations for anything, anywhere. Franco was like a brother at the end of the trip. He was kind and thoughtful and made sure I had a terrific trip. Andrea was also a gem.…

title: Wonderful visit at The Adler Cavalieri
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great hotel and location
review: Wonderful overnight experience!  The room was spotless.  The staff was so helpful, providing excellent directions and even an umbrella!  I highly recommend - the hotel is close to the train station as well as within walking distance of many of the interesting sights.  I wish we had more time to spend in Florence - two days was not enough.  We'll stay at the Adler Cavalieri again.

title: Very nice rooms and service
review: We have just returned from a five night stay at this lovely hotel.We were impressed by the standard of service and helpfulness of the staff. The rooms were spotless and spacious with a well appointed bathroom. It would have been nice to have coffee making facilities, but that would be our only criticism.Breakfast was buffet style but with plenty of choice. The position near the station was great, so convenient. There were good restaurants nearby and all the main sights were within walking distance.We would not hesitate to use this hotel again.

title: A peaceful oasis in the centre of town
review: We stayed for two nights and couldn't have been more pleased. All of the staff were very professional. Lisa at the front desk was very helpful as was the waiter at breakfast and the evening bartender. Our room was wonderful, big and clean. For us, this was a sidetrip and we found the hotel to be a place to relax and regroup before heading back to Rome.

title: Great Hotel

Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Good Hotel
review: Great boutique hotel. So sooooooooo clean. I am a bit of a germ freak and I can tell you that their bathroom is almost clean enough to eat off (I wouldn't but you get the point).  Its small but average in NYC standards and all the fixtures seem really new.  The room was standard but well taken care of and quite comfortable.  Completely silent.  The room was a bit chilly even though I had it set at 24C.  I talked to the front desk and surprisingly, they had a high tech online system of tracking room temperatures and so they increased our room control "ranges".  Pretty cool.  They had a nice strong hairdryer (bonus pts for that).  The doorkey is a magnetic card but the door had to be slammed shut to lock.  The hotel staff was great.  The front desk was helpful in making…

title: Honeymoon Bliss
review: Stayed with my wife on a w/e trip to Florence. I booked direct with the hotel via their bilingual web site.  Hotel is very convenient to the SMN (central Station). Staff were polite and helpful and made our stay enjoyable. There was much talk before going that the main street outside the hotel would be noisy but we had a room in the back which was very quiet.  The room was average size with a spotlessly clean bathroom. Breakfast was good continental with none of the awful cremated american bacon.  Florence is a beautiful city to wnder through and we walked to everywhere from the hotel. The Uffizi is c.15 mins walk . One thing not to miss is the Central Indoor market and streets around. Carcking produce at good prices (take home the sun dried tomatoes which are vacuum packed) …

title: This Hotel is a Jewel
review: We visited Florence for a week on our Honeymoon. With this being our first trip to Europe, I was nervous about the hotel based on what I've heard. I was SO pleasantly surprised when we walked into the hotel Adler Cavalieri. If you are planning day trips, it is very close to the train station which we found convenient. The lobby was nice and the staff was very friendly and welcoming. I booked the hotel online and there were no problems checking in. The staff was incredibly helpful exchanging our currency, calling cabs, and making both museum & dinner reservations for us. It was a huge help to us! We were quite happy with the room. It was large, well furnished, and CLEAN. It was comparable to an American hotel chain. Phew! Our view looked out onto their courtyard, which was nice.…

title: very very good hotel
review: This beautiful boutique hotel was just what we were hoping for after the long flight from California. The rooms were immaculate and charming and a soak in the jacuzzi tub of the marble bath a treat for tired tourists. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the location is convenient. We would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great Service, Nice Hotel!
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: a must!!!
review: My experience at this hotel made my trip to Florence much more enjoyable.  Our entire vacation was rained out while in Florence and we spent a lot more time in the hotel than we anticipated.  This, however, was an enjoyable experience.  First of all, this hotel is located very conveniently near the subway station as well as most tourist hot spots.  The hotel is decorated very tastefully and it feels very welcoming.  The rooms are not very spacious but such is the case in Europe.  The rooms are, however, very clean and thoughtfully laid out.  The bathrooms are, again, small with NO counter space but very clean and well-maintained.  The complimentary breakfast is a nice touch and would be even more enjoyable if it were not raining-you could sit out on the terrace.  The hotel staff…

title: Good location, excellent hotel
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Beautiful City, Beautiful Hotel
review: This is a great location for a hotel in Florence, especially if you are planning day trips out of the city, since the buses and train are literally right around the corner.  I found the Adler immaculately clean and the staff extremely helpful.  The rooms were pretty standard and quiet.  I would most definitely stay there again.

title: Great hotel!  Highly recommend it!
review: I am a businessman who goes to Italy once a year. Every year, I find myself staying at this hotel. It is on a busy street in the busy part of town. But once you get inside, you will hardly notice the outside world. Tastefully decorated, pleasant staff, and a calming atmosphere makes for a wonderful environment. I took my son and friend with me this time, and the stay was no exception. Everyone had a terrific time and enjoyed their stay. If you are travelling to Florence, I recommend this hotel. You will not regret your choice.

title: Terrific boutique hotel in great location
review: My husband and I stayed at the Adler Cavalieri for two nights in late April 2005.  The hotel staff was extremely welcoming, kind and helpful.  We had tried to book reservations to the Uffizi a few days before and they said they were booked until May 11!  The staff at the Adler Cavalieri were able to get us immediate reservations to the Uffizi as well as the Accademia.  They provided us with a city map upon check-in, pointing out the "hot spots" as well as a few of their favorite shops and restaurants.   The room was very spacious (especially compared to the very small one we came from in Rome), was immaculately cleaned, had a great view of the garden courtyard, nice bathroom and my favorite part...they leave the yummiest chocolates on your pillow!  What a great treat after…
